  • Airport or bus station transfers
Overview: Experience the charm of the Himalayas with our Exotic Manali Tour Package. Nestled in the picturesque Kullu Valley, Manali is a perfect destination for nature lovers, adventure enthusiasts, and those seeking tranquility. From snow-capped mountains and lush valleys to ancient temples and thrilling adventures, this tour offers a delightful mix of relaxation and excitement.

description.S:
• 3:00 pm to 4:00 pm: Check-in at Taj West End
  • 4:00 pm to 5:00 pm: High Tea at the Banquet Hall
  • 5:00 pm to 5:30 pm: Presentation on The Golden Chariot Tour, covering dos and don’ts, safety, and security.
  • 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm: Visit to Chitrakala Parishad / Art Gallery
  • 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm: Enjoy a Cultural Show
  • 8:00 pm: Arrive at Yeshwantpur Railway Station, Platform No. 6, for a traditional Indian welcome.
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot
  • 9:00 pm: Depart for Mysore

    • Alternate Itinerary
  • 11:00 am: Check-in at Our Native Village
  • 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm: Lunch
  • 3:00 pm to 3:30 pm: Resort Tour – Learn what makes us a 100% eco-resort
  • 4:00 pm to 4:30 pm: Herbal & Medicinal Plant Tour and Organic Farm Tour
  • 4:30 pm to 5:30 pm: Pottery Session & Explore traditional village games and enjoy Bullock Cart Rides
  • 6:00 pm to 6:30 pm: Rest before departing for Yeshwantpur Railway Station
    • (Note: Alternate itinerary is for those who choose not to check-in at Leela Palace and participate in the Bangalore sightseeing tour.)

• 10:00 am: Depart for Kabini / Bandipur after breakfast
  • 1:00 pm: Arrive at Jungle Lodge for Lunch
  • Post-lunch: Go for a Jungle Safari / Boat Safari
  • Evening: Watch a wildlife film
  • Dinner and overnight stay at Jungle Lodge

    • Alternate Itinerary
  • Visit Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary
  • Explore Mysore Zoo
  • Lunch onboard
  • Visit Brindavan Gardens
  • Kabini: A Wildlife Haven
  • Rajiv Gandhi National Park (Nagarhole/Kabini) is an ideal destination for wildlife enthusiasts. A safari through the heart of the park offers sightings of elephants, gaur, sambar, and even elusive predators like tigers and leopards. The park is home to over 300 bird species, making it a bird watcher's paradise.

• 8:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 11:30 am: Return to The Golden Chariot
  • 1:00 pm: Lunch onboard
  • 3:00 pm: Mysore sightseeing - Visit Mysore Palace and Srirangapatnam.
  • 7:00 pm: Arrive at Lalitha Mahal Palace for a cultural show, followed by dinner
  • 10:00 pm: Back onboard The Golden Chariot

    • Mysore: A Royal Legacy
    Mysore is known for its royal heritage, splendid palaces, and majestic buildings. It is also famous for its music, dance, arts, and crafts. The Mysore Palace, built in Indo-Saracenic style, is a treasure trove of art and architecture. Visit Srirangapatnam, Tipu Sultan’s fortress, which houses important historical sites like the mosque and the dungeons were British officers were held captive.

• 6:00 am: Depart from Mysore to Hassan
  • 8:15 am: Arrive at Hassan
  • 9:00 am: Depart for Shravanabelagola (Note: A climb of 700 steps is required to reach the statue. Palanquins are available for those who prefer not to climb.)
  • 1:00 pm: Lunch onboard
  • 3:00 pm: Depart for Belur and Halebid for sightseeing
  • 7:15 pm: Back onboard The Golden Chariot
  • 7:45 pm: Depart for Hospet
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot

    • Belur & Halebid: A World of Worship
    Belur is famous for its stunning Hoysala Temple Complex, including the Chennakesava Temple, which showcases intricate sculptures. Halebid, once the capital of the Hoysala dynasty, is home to the beautiful Hoysaleswara Temple. Shravanabelagola features Asia’s largest monolithic statue of Lord Gomateswara, standing 58 feet tall.

• 6:00 am: Arrive in Hospet
  • 8:30 am: After breakfast, depart for Hampi sightseeing: Virupaksha Temple, Queens’ Bath, Elephant Stables, and the Local Crafts Bazaar
  • 1:00 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Lunch
  • 3:00 pm: Continue sightseeing: Royal Enclosure, Hazara Rama Temple, and Illuminated Vittala Temple
  • 8:00 pm: Return onboard The Golden Chariot for Dinner

    • Hampi: A World Heritage Site
    Hampi, once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire, is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The ruins, scattered across 26 square kilometers, tell tales of grandeur and glory. Explore the temples and palaces, including the Vittala Temple, which features an impressive stone chariot.

• 5:00 am: Depart from Hospet to Badami
  • Arrive in Badami around 8:30 am.
  • 9:00 am: After breakfast, explore the Badami Caves and Pattadakal
  • 1:30 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Lunch
  • 2:00 pm: Depart for Goa.
  • Relax onboard and enjoy facilities like the Spa and Gym
  • Dinner onboard The Golden Chariot
  • Reach Goa post-midnight

    • Badami: A World Heritage Site
    Badami, with its stunning rock-cut temples and caves, offers a glimpse into India’s rich history. Pattadakal, known for its Chalukyan architecture, is another UNESCO World Heritage site and a testament to the region’s cultural richness.

• 9:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 10:00 am: Depart for Goa sightseeing
  • 11:00 am: Visit the famous churches of Old Goa
  • 12:15 pm: Explore an old Portuguese house: Sola Souto Maior for tea/coffee and shopping
  • 2:00 pm: Lunch at Majorda Beach Resort
  • 3:00 pm: Relax with an Ayurvedic massage, visit the casino, or enjoy the pool and beach (extra charges apply)
  • 6:00 pm: Depart from the resort
  • 7:15 pm: Return to The Golden Chariot for Dinner
  • 9:00 pm: Depart for Bangalore

    • Goa: A World of Golden Beaches
    Goa is known for its beautiful beaches, colonial architecture, and relaxed pace of life. With its rich history, stunning landscapes, and vibrant culture, Goa is more than just a beach destination.

• 8:00 am to 9:30 am: Breakfast onboard
  • 11:00 am: Arrive at Yeshwantpur Railway Station, where you’ll be farewelled by the entire crew.

Name: The Golden Chariot
LocationDescription: Bangalore - Kabini/Bandipur - Mysore - Hassan - Hospet - Badami - Goa - Bangalore
Title: The Golden Chariot Tour Package India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore India's rich heritage with The Golden Chariot tour package. Visit Bangalore, Kabini, Mysore, Hassan, Hospet, Badami, Goa, and return to Bangalore.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather.
  • Ideal For: Luxury travelers, history buffs, and culture enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, travel essentials, and a camera to capture the experience.
  • Advance booking is recommended due to limited availability.
Whats_Included:
• Luxury accommodation aboard the Golden Chariot train
  • All meals, including regional and international cuisine
  • Guided tours of historic and cultural landmarks
  • Private transportation for off-train excursions
  • Entry tickets to monuments and attractions
  • Professional tour guides for all sightseeing activities
  • Access to onboard facilities such as a spa, lounge, and dining cars
Overview: Step aboard the Golden Chariot, a luxury train that takes you on an unforgettable journey through South India’s rich history, stunning landscapes, and vibrant culture. This award-winning train offers world-class amenities and visits some of the most iconic destinations, including ancient temples, palaces, and wildlife sanctuaries. Whether you’re a history enthusiast or a lover of luxury, this tour is designed to give you a royal experience.

description.S:
• Embark on a luxurious journey aboard the Royal Rajasthan on Wheels for a seven-day exploration through the vibrant state of Rajasthan.
  • The adventure begins in New Delhi, where your royal journey commences, taking you through the magnificent former princely states of India.
  • Upon your arrival at Safdarjung Station, you will be welcomed with a traditional greeting, including a ceremonial aarti, tika, garlanding, and refreshing mocktails.
  • After check-in, you will be escorted to your private cabin. Experience the true essence of royal life aboard a moving palace, where luxury and tradition are seamlessly combined.

name.S: Monday, Arrival at 09:15 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 17:10 PM Jodhpur

description.S:
• The second-largest city in Rajasthan, Jodhpur, is renowned for its magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, which stands as a symbol of Rajput glory.
  • Another highlight is Jaswant Thada, a marble cenotaph built in 1899. Enjoy lunch at a hotel, and in the evening, return to the train for dinner onboard.

name.S: Tuesday, Arrival at 08:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 14:30 PM Udaipur

description.S:
• Known as the 'Venice of the East,' Udaipur is a mesmerizing city filled with royal palaces, gardens, and temples. It embodies the dreams of Rajputana grandeur. Explore the City Palace, which is a testament to the city’s regal past.
  • After lunch at a hotel, enjoy a visit to the Crystal Gallery, home to exquisite collections of crystal artifacts.

name.S: Tuesday, Arrival at 16:45 PM | Departure at 22:00 PM Chittorgarh

description.S:
• Chittorgarh Fort is steeped in history, telling the tale of valor, sacrifice, and bravery. The Vijay Stambh (Victory Tower) and the Gaumukh Reservoir, along with the Palace of Queen Padmini, are among the key attractions here.
  • In the evening, enjoy the captivating light and sound show at the fort. Afterward, head to a hotel for a cultural performance, followed by dinner.

name.S: Wednesday, Arrival at 05:30 AM, Breakfast onboard or at Hotel Vinayak | Departure at 11:00 AM Sawai Madhopur

description.S:
• The famed Ranthambore National Park and Ranthambore Fort are located in the eastern part of Rajasthan. The park is home to majestic tigers and other wildlife, offering a fantastic safari experience. Also, visit the Amareshwar Mohadeo Temple en route.
  • Enjoy lunch onboard before continuing your journey.

name.S: Wednesday, Arrival at 13:15 PM | Departure at 22:15 PM Jaipur

description.S:
• In Jaipur, the capital of Rajasthan, you’ll be welcomed by caparisoned elephants and the sounds of the Shehnai.
  • Visit the Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds) and experience an elephant ride at Amber Fort.
  • After shopping for centuries-old artifacts, enjoy a visit to the City Palace, the residence of the former Maharaja, which houses a museum filled with fascinating historical artifacts.
  • Lunch at a hotel and dinner at a hotel with a cultural program follow.

name.S: Thursday, Arrival at 11:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 18:30 PM Khajuraho

description.S:
• The Khajuraho Temples, built between the 9th and 12th centuries, are famous for their intricate sculptures depicting passion, eroticism, dance, music, and other aspects of Indian culture.
  • Located in Madhya Pradesh, these temples are masterpieces of architecture and artistry, with only 20 of them surviving the test of time.
  • Visit the temples and museum, and enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

name.S: Friday, Arrival at 06:00 AM | Departure at 18:00 PM Varanasi

description.S:
• The spiritual capital of India, Varanasi, is over 3,000 years old and is famous for its temples and sacred ghats along the Ganges River.
  • Visit the Jyotirlinga Visvanatha Temple (Golden Temple) and the Jnana Vapi well.
  • Experience the vibrant Maha Aarti ceremony at the ghats and visit the Buddhist temples at Sarnath.
  • After a hotel lunch, return for dinner onboard.

name.S: Saturday, Arrival at 05:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 23:00 PM Agra

description.S:
• Famous for the iconic Taj Mahal and the historic Agra Fort, Agra is a must-visit destination for any traveler. The city is also known for its rich culture and craftsmanship, including marble inlay work, leather goods, footwear, and brassware.
  • After a visit to the Taj Mahal and other attractions, enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

name.S: Sunday, Arrival at 07:00 AM, Breakfast onboard, Check-out at 07:45 AM Delhi

description.S: The Royal Rajasthan on Wheels journey concludes as you arrive back in Delhi, marking the end of this magnificent week-long exploration.

Name: Royal Rajasthan on Wheels
Title: Best Rajasthan Tour Packages India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore the rich heritage of Rajasthan with our customized tour packages. Book your adventure today and experience royal palaces, forts, and vibrant culture.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather and festive celebrations.
  • Ideal For: Families, couples, solo travelers, and history enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, sunscreen, and a camera.
  • Customization options available for personalized itineraries.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in heritage hotels or luxury resorts
  • Daily breakfast and dinner
  • Private transportation for sightseeing and transfers
  • Guided tours to historic forts, palaces, and temples
  • Camel safari and cultural evening in the desert (optional)
  • Entry tickets to monuments and attractions
  • Airport or railway station transfers
Overview: Dive into the regal charm of Rajasthan with our Rajasthan Tour Packages. Known for its rich history, majestic palaces, golden deserts, and vibrant culture, Rajasthan is a destination that captures the heart of every traveler. Whether you’re exploring Jaipur’s Pink City, the blue streets of Jodhpur, or the golden sands of Jaisalmer, this tour promises an enchanting experience filled with unforgettable memories.

description.S:
• The journey begins at Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station, where guests are warmly welcomed with traditional ceremonies before embarking on the Palace-on-Wheels for a week-long luxurious tour through the enchanting state of Rajasthan.
  • Reporting Time: 18:00 hrs, Departure: 18:30 hrs.

• The first destination is Jaipur, one of the most well-planned cities of its time and the capital of Rajasthan. Known as the Pink City, it was founded by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II in 1727 A.D.
  • A guided tour takes you to Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), a remarkable five-story building with semi-octagonal, honeycombed windows that adorn the main street in pink splendor.
  • Next, visit Amber Fort, where you can enjoy an elephant ride to ascend the hill.
  • After lunch at a five-star hotel, continue your exploration with a visit to the City Palace Museum and Jantar Mantar (Observatory).
  • Arrival: 03:45 hrs and Departure: 20:00 hrs.

• Arriving in Sawai Madhopur, named after Maharaja Sawai Madho Singh I, you will visit the Ranthambore National Park after breakfast. Known for its 10th-century fort ruins, this sanctuary is famous for offering one of the best opportunities in India to photograph and observe tigers in their natural habitat.
  • The park spans over 392 sq. km and is home to over 300 species of birds and a variety of carnivorous animals, including tigers, hyenas, and jackals.
  • Sawai Madhopur is also known for its exclusive toys, ethnic ornaments, and costumes.
  • Afterward, travel to Chittorgarh, enjoying the beautiful countryside views.
  • Arrival: 05:30 hrs and Departure: 10:20 hrs
  • Arrival in Chittorgarh: 16:00 hrs and Departure: 02:00 hrs (next day, Saturday)

• Next, the Palace-on-Wheels arrives in Udaipur, also known as the Lake City. Founded in 1559 A.D. by Maharana Udai Singh of the Mewar dynasty, the city is renowned for its beautiful marble palaces that rise majestically from Lake Pichola.
  • Two of the most stunning sites in Udaipur are the Jag Niwas (Lake Palace) and Jag Mandir, which look like dreamlike castles floating on the water.
  • After lunch at a five-star hotel, enjoy a visit to the City Palace, a grand complex with intricate architecture.
  • Arrival: 08:00 hrs and Departure: 15:30 hrs

• Located in the heart of the Thar Desert, Jaisalmer was founded by Rawal Jaisal in 1156 A.D. The impressive Yellow Sandstone Fort dominates the city, offering breathtaking views.
  • Explore the finely carved havelis, such as Nathmalji-ki-Haveli, Patwon-ki-Haveli, and Salim Singh-ki-Haveli, which showcase the exquisite skills of stone carvers.
  • You can shop for locally crafted goods such as pattu shawls, mirror work, embroidered articles, wooden trinkets, silver jewelry, and unique curios.
  • After lunch on board, take an exciting camel ride on the sand dunes of Sam and enjoy a refreshing cup of tea.
  • In the evening, enjoy dinner and a cultural performance at a five-star hotel.
  • Arrival: 09:15 hrs and Departure: 23:30 hrs

• Arriving in Jodhpur, a city surrounded by a high stone wall with seven gates, you’ll explore Mehrangarh Fort, founded in 1459 A.D. by Rao Jodha. This massive fort is home to impressive palaces, including Moti Mahal, Sheesh Mahal, Phool Mahal, and Sileh Khana.
  • Visit Jaswant Thada, a white marble cenotaph near the fort. After lunch at a palace hotel, return to the Palace-on-Wheels and shop for exquisite handicrafts such as embroidered shoes, metal curios, silverware, paintings, and tie-dye fabrics.
  • Arrival: 07:00 hrs and Departure: 16:30 hrs

• In the morning, visit Bharatpur, the capital of Maharaja Suraj Mal, and explore the world-famous Keoladeo Ghana National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its diverse birdlife, including migratory Siberian Cranes, Egrets, and other species.
  • Arrival: 05:00 hrs and Departure: 08:45 hrs
  • Arriving in Agra, visit the majestic Agra Fort and, after lunch, proceed to the iconic Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World. This pristine monument of eternal love was built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife, Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Agra is also renowned for its marble inlay work, leather goods, and jewelry.
  • Arrival: 10:00 hrs and Departure: 19:30 hrs

• The Palace-on-Wheels returns to Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station, where your unforgettable journey concludes.
  • Enjoy a final breakfast onboard and reminisce about the beautiful experiences of the past week.
  • Arrival: 07:30 hrs

Name: Palace on Wheels
LocationDescription: New Delhi - Jaipur - Sawai Madhopur - Chittorgarh - Udaipur - Jaisalmer - Jodhpur - Bharatpur - Agra - Delhi
Title: Palace on Wheels Tour Package India - Ease Tours
Description: Experience the Palace on Wheels tour package India, covering New Delhi, Jaipur, Sawai Madhopur, Udaipur, Jaisalmer, and more. A royal journey across India.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Travel: October to March for the best weather and sightseeing experiences.
  • Ideal For: Luxury travelers, history enthusiasts, and cultural explorers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, a camera, and travel essentials.
  • Advance booking is required due to limited availability.
Whats_Included:
• Luxurious accommodation onboard the Palace on Wheels train
  • All meals, featuring Indian and international cuisine
  • Guided tours of historical landmarks and cultural attractions
  • Private transportation for off-train excursions
  • Entry tickets to monuments and parks
  • Services of professional tour guides
  • Onboard amenities, including a spa, lounge, and bar
Overview: Experience the grandeur of India with the Palace on Wheels, one of the most luxurious trains in the world. This extraordinary journey takes you through India’s most iconic destinations, offering a blend of royal heritage, vibrant culture, and stunning landscapes. From the majestic forts of Rajasthan to the timeless beauty of the Taj Mahal, this package promises a royal experience like no other.

name.S: Arrive in Delhi (Normal check-in time at the hotel is 14:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Arrive at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where you will be met by our representative holding a placard in the arrival lounge.
  • After a warm welcome, transfer to your hotel and check-in. Delhi, the capital of India, is a city of contrasts – a vibrant metropolis where history and modernity coexist. The city has been the seat of many great dynasties, leaving behind a legacy of architectural wonders.
  • Located on the banks of the Yamuna River, Delhi has seen numerous cities rise and fall over the last five millennia.
  • Overnight in Delhi.

• Start your day with a hearty breakfast at the hotel.
  • Afterward, enjoy a full-day sightseeing tour of both Old and New Delhi.
    • Morning:
    Explore Old Delhi with a drive past the Red Fort (outside only), an iconic citadel made of red sandstone built by Shah Jahan in the 17th century. Nearby, visit Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque, also commissioned by Shah Jahan. Take a rickshaw ride through the bustling Chandni Chowk, a vibrant market area full of shops selling everything from clothes to spices. If time permits, visit Raj Ghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi.
    Afternoon:
    Continue your exploration of New Delhi with a visit to the Qutub Minar, a UNESCO World Heritage site and the tallest brick minaret in the world. See the Iron Pillar, which has baffled scientists for its resistance to rust for over 1,600 years. Then, visit Humayun's Tomb, a stunning example of Mughal architecture and a precursor to the Taj Mahal. Also stop by India Gate, the national war memorial, and the Rashtrapati Bhawan, the residence of India’s President.Overnight in Delhi.

name.S: Delhi to Agra (Approx. 205 km / 5 to 5.5 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast at your hotel, drive to Agra, home to the world-famous Taj Mahal.
  • Upon arrival, check in at your hotel. Agra is a city steeped in Mughal history, known for its stunning palaces, forts, and mausoleums that reflect the grandeur of the empire.
  • Agra was the capital of the Mughal Empire for over 100 years. It is also famous for its intricate marble inlay work, leather products, and carpets.
  • Overnight in Agra.

name.S: Agra to Varanasi (Overnight Train) (Normal check-out time is 12:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Start your day with breakfast at the hotel, then head out for a tour of Agra’s major attractions.
  • Visit the Taj Mahal, the eternal symbol of love built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Closed on Fridays, this exquisite white marble mausoleum is one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
  • Then, explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and Itimad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb, often referred to as the 'Baby Taj' due to its resemblance to the Taj Mahal.
  • In the evening, transfer to Agra Railway Station to board your overnight train to Varanasi.
  • Train Details:
  • Train Name/Number: Marudhar Express – 14864
  • Departure from Agra: 21:20 hrs
  • Arrival in Varanasi: 08:35 hrs (Next morning)
  • Proposed Class: 3 Tier Air-conditioned Sleeper

name.S: Arrive in Varanasi (Normal check-in time at the hotel is 12:00 hrs)

description.S:
• Upon arrival at Mughal Sarai Railway Station, you will be transferred to your hotel.
  • Varanasi (also known as Kashi or Benaras) is one of the world’s oldest living cities and the holiest city in India for Hindus. It has been a center for culture, education, and spirituality for over 2,000 years.
  • In the afternoon, visit the Banaras Hindu University and the famous Bharat Kala Bhavan Museum.
  • Explore the Bharat Mata Temple, Durga Temple, and Vishwanath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva.
  • In the evening, witness the mesmerizing Aarti ceremony at Dashashwamedh Ghat.
  • Overnight in Varanasi.

• Early in the morning, enjoy a boat ride on the Ganges River at sunrise, a serene and spiritual experience as pilgrims perform their rituals.
  • As you float past the ghats, you’ll see people praying, bathing, and performing last rites.
  • Visit the burning ghats, where the deceased are cremated in the traditional manner.
  • In the afternoon, travel to Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment.
  • Explore the Chowkandi Stupa, Dhamek Stupa, and the ruins of ancient monasteries. Don’t miss the Sarnath Museum (closed on Fridays).
  • Overnight in Varanasi.

name.S: Varanasi to Bodhgaya (Approx. 242 km / 5 to 6 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Bodhgaya, the site where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree.
  • Visit the Mahabodhi Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage site, with its stunning architecture and a large gilded statue of Buddha.
  • The temple complex is home to a tree descended from the original Bodhi tree.
  • Overnight in Bodhgaya.

• After breakfast, proceed for an excursion to Rajgir and Nalanda.
  • In Rajgir, visit the Vishwa Shanti Stupa and the Saptaparni Caves, where the first Buddhist council was held.
  • See the Bimbisara Jail and Jarasandha’s Akhra. Later, continue to Nalanda, an ancient university and center of Buddhist learning from the 5th to 12th centuries.
  • Explore the ruins of the university and visit the Nalanda Museum.
  • Return to Bodhgaya for the night.
  • Overnight in Bodhgaya.

• After breakfast, drive to Vaishali, where Buddha delivered his last sermon.
  • Visit the Ashoka Pillar and the Lotus Tank. Then, continue to Kushinagar, the site where Buddha attained Mahaparinirvana (final liberation).
  • Explore the monuments and the Parinirvana Stupa, marking the place where Buddha passed away.
  • Overnight in Kushinagar.

name.S: Kushinagar to Lumbini (Approx. 173 km / 4 to 5 hrs)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Lumbini, the birthplace of Buddha.
  • En route, visit the Mahakala Caves. In Lumbini, explore the Ashoka Pillar, the Maya Devi Temple, and the Lumbini Museum, which highlights the history of Buddha's birth and early life.
  • Overnight in Lumbini.

name.S: Lumbini to Kapilvastu & Shravasti (Approx. 86 km to Kapilvastu & 147 km to Shravasti)

description.S:
• Visit Ashoka’s Pillar in Lumbini before heading to Kapilvastu, the site of the ancient city where Buddha spent his early years.
  • Continue to Shravasti, a key place for Buddhists, where Buddha performed miracles.
  • Visit the ruins and the Jetavana Monastery.
  • Overnight in Shravasti.

name.S: Shravasti to Gorakhpur & Delhi (Overnight Train) (Approx. 51 km to Gorakhpur)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Gorakhpur and board your overnight train back to Delhi.
  • Train Details:
  • Train Name/Number: Vaishali Exp. – 12553
  • Departure from Gorakhpur: 17:05 hrs
  • Arrival in Delhi: 06:30 hrs (Next morning)
  • Proposed Class: 3 Tier Air-conditioned Sleeper

• Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward journey.
  • End of tour.

Name: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour
Title: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour Package India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore India’s sacred sites with our Buddhist pilgrimage tour package. Visit Delhi, Agra, Varanasi, Bodhgaya, Vaishali, Kushinagar, Shravasti, & Gorakhpur.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather.
  • Ideal For: Spiritual seekers, history enthusiasts, and cultural travelers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, walking shoes, and a notebook for reflections.
  • Customizable itineraries are available based on your preferences.
Whats_Included:
• Comfortable accommodation at hotels and guesthouses
  • Daily breakfast and vegetarian meals
  • Private transportation for all transfers and sightseeing
  • Guided tours to Buddhist sites
  • Entry tickets to monuments and temples
  • Professional tour guides with expertise in Buddhist heritage
  • Assistance with travel permits where required
Overview: Embark on a transformative journey with our Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour Package, exploring the sacred sites that trace the life and teachings of Lord Buddha. From the enlightenment at Bodh Gaya to the first sermon at Sarnath, this package is designed for spiritual seekers and cultural enthusiasts alike. Immerse yourself in the tranquility and profound wisdom of Buddhism as you visit these revered destinations.

description.S:
• Upon your arrival in Delhi, our tour representative will meet you and assist you in smooth transfer to Rishikesh via road.
  • Upon arrival in Rishikesh, check in at the hotel. The evening is free to relax and briefing.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Rishikesh:
    The birthplace of Yoga, Rishikesh is located 24 kilometers away from HarIdwar. It is a place where pilgrims come to meditate, do yoga and learn about other aspects of Hinduism. There are many ancient and newly built temples along the river Ganges. The whole town is consIdered to be sacred and it is saId that meditation here leads to salvation.

• After morning breakfast, embark on a local sightseeing tour of Rishikesh which includes Ram Jhula, Laxman Jhula, and Swarg Ashram.
  • Later, drive to Barkot via Mussoorie. On the way, visit Kempty Falls and reach Barkot by late evening.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Barkot – Jankichatti – Yamunotri – Barkot (50 kms & 6 kms. Trek)

description.S:
• After morning breakfast, proceed to Yamunotri and later move up to Jankichatti.
  • Enjoy a 6 km trek to Yamunotri. Here, one can cook rice by packing it in a cloth and dipping it in the hot water of the Kund. Pilgrims take this cooked rice home as “Prasad”.
  • Nearby the temple, Pooja can be offered to Divya Shila after taking a bath in Jamunabai Kund and offering prayers to Yamunaji.
  • Later, return to Barkot. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Yamunotri:
  • The source of the river Yamuna and the seat of the river goddess, Yamunotri is situated at an altitude of 3,293 meters in the Garhwal Himalayas.
  • It originates from the Champasar Glacier, located 1 kilometer ahead of the shrine. Yamunotri was the home of an ancient sage, ‘Asit Muni’.
  • The goddess Yamuna is the daughter of the Sun, and Yama is the brother of the river goddess. It is believed that taking a dip in the holy waters of Yamuna provides blessings.
  • Surya Kund: Surya Kund is a hot water spring containing sulfur, known for its healing properties.
  • Divya Shila: Divya Shila is a rock pillar worshipped before entering the Yamunotri temple.
  • Travel to Gangotri, take a holy dip in the river, and visit the temple.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Uttarkashi. Later, drive to Harsil.
  • The evening is free for leisure and exploring local attractions.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, take a road trip to Gangotri. After praying at the temple, have Pooja & Darshan at Gangotri temple.
  • Later, return back to Uttarkashi. Dinner and overnight stay at Uttarkashi.

    • Gangotri:
    Located in the 18th century, Gangotri is dedicated to Hindu goddess ‘Ganga’. It is located near a sacred stone where Bhagirath worshipped Lord Shiva and asked to hold Ganga in his matted locks. The temple is a beautiful 20 feet high structure made up of white granite. This is the perfect place to reconnect with you. The Gangotri temple dedicated to the goddess remains open from May to November.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Guptkashi. En route, see the heritage city of Tehri submerged into the mighty waters of the holy river Ganges.
  • Later in the evening, you’ll have to reach Guptkashi.
  • Dinner and stay overnight at the hotel.

    • Guptkashi:
    Located in the northern Himalayan belt within the Mandakini river valley, which houses lush green forests, Guptkashi is famous for the Vishwanath temple- dedicated to Lord Shiva.

• Post breakfast, take a road trip up to Helipad as per the reporting time.
  • Complete the boarding formalities and wait here for your time slot.
  • Upon arrival at Kedarnath, perform early Pooja & Darshan at the temple. Later, return back to Helipad and take a return flight to Guptkashi, before you drive back to Rudraprayag.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Kedarnath Temple:
    Built in the 8th century A.D. by Adi Guru Shankaracharya, the Kedarnath Temple is located adjacent to the site of an ancient temple built by Pandavas. As the name suggests, the temple is dedicated to the shrine of Kedar. Kedarnath is one of the four holy places that cover the famous Char Dham Yatra. It is believed to be one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. The temple is believed to be over 1000 years old.

• Post breakfast, take a road trip to Badrinath. On the way, visit Narsingh Temple and Adi Shankaracharya Samadhi at Joshimath.
  • Later, drive to Badrinath and do Pooja & Darshan at the temple.
  • Thereafter, visit the famous tourist sites in Badrinath such as Vyas Cave, Ganesh Cave, Bhim Bridge, and the origin of River Saraswati at Mana Village, the last village before entering the Tibetan border.
  • Later, visit the temple for holy Darshan/Pooja and attend evening Aarti.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Badrinath Temple:
    One of the holiest temples in Uttarakhand, Badrinath is nestled between the twin mountain ranges - Nar and Narayan. Badrinath Temple is also known as Badrinarayan temple because it is dedicated to Lord Vishnu’s form of Badrinarayan. The temple is supposed to have been built by the 8th century saint ‘Adi Shankracharya’, the great scholar and philosopher. The original temple was destroyed in a landslIde. The present temple is believed to have been built by the Garhwal kings in the 17th century.
    Narad Kund:
    Narad Kund is one of the most revered centers in Badrinath. It is a holy site from where Adi Sankara recovered the Idol of Lord Vishnu.
    Brahma Kapal:
    It is a flat platform located on the banks of the Alaknanda River, where Lord Brahma is believed to resIde. The devotees pay homage and rituals to the departed souls.
    Sheshnetra:
    Located on the opposite bank of the river, Sheshnetra is a place where the eye of the serpent lord ‘Shesha’ on which Vishnu rests, is seen on a rock.
    Mana Village:
    Mana Village is a quaint tiny hamlet located on the Indo-Tibetan border. The village is now declared as a tourism village of India.
    Bhim Pul:
    It is an attractive rock brIdge in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand. Just 4 kms away from Mana Village, this natural brIdge lies over the roaring Saraswati River.
    Vyas Gufa (Cave):
    Located at a distance of 3 kilometers away from Badrinath temple, Vyas Gufa is a rock-cave where Ved Vyas is believed to have composed the Mahabharata and the Puranic commentaries.

• In the morning, after Mahaabhishek, go for Pooja and Darshan.
  • Post breakfast, leave by road for Srinagar.
  • On the way, visit Vishnuprayag, Nandprayag, Karnprayag, and Rudraprayag.
  • Later, take a road trip to Srinagar.
  • Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Haridwar.
  • On the way, visit Devprayag, the confluence of Alaknanda and Bhagirathi River.
  • In the afternoon, you will arrive in Haridwar. Later, check into the hotel and get relaxed.
  • Visit the famous places such as Mansa Devi and Chandi Devi Temples.
  • In the evening, attend the famous Ganga Aarti at Har ki Pauri. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

    • Haridwar:
    Located at the feet of Shiva’s hills ‘Shivaliks’, HarIdwar is located in the HarIdwar district of Uttarakhand. It is one of the 7 holiest Hindu cities in India. Apart from being a famous tourist destination in India, HarIdwar is also famous among the people as being the location of Kumbh Mela. The lighted diyas floating on the river Ganges creates a spectacular sight. The town is dotted with innumerable temples and other religious places.

• Post breakfast, leave by road for Delhi.
  • On reaching Delhi, drop at the railway station for onward journey.

Name: Chardham tour
Title: Chardham Pilgrimage Tour Package India – Eaze Tours
Description: Embark on a spiritual journey with our Chardham pilgrimage tour package in India, covering Delhi, Rishikesh, Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath, & more.
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: May to October, as the temples are open to pilgrims during this period.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, spiritual seekers, and families seeking blessings.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, warm attire (especially for Kedarnath), and essentials for travel.
  • Physical Fitness: Some trekking is required, especially to Kedarnath and Yamunotri.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in comfortable hotels or guesthouses
  • Daily breakfast and meals as per the itinerary
  • Private transport for all transfers and sightseeing
  • Experienced guides for temple visits and local tours
  • Entry fees to temples and sanctuaries
  • Assistance with Darshan and poojas (if required)
  • All necessary permits and arrangements
Overview: Embark on a divine and spiritually enriching journey with our Chardham Pilgrimage Tour Package, taking you to the four sacred shrines of Uttarakhand: Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath. These revered destinations are considered the spiritual gateways to liberation and are believed to cleanse the soul. This tour offers an unforgettable experience for devotees seeking divine blessings and peace.

name.S: Day 01 ARRIVE DELHI (Check in time is 1200 Hrs)

description.S: On arrival at Indira Gandhi international airport, Meeting and assistance on arrival and transfer to the hotel. Check-in time is 12 Noon. Afternoon: Sightseeing tour of Old Delhi. Visit Jama MasjId, drive pass tour the Red Fort, visit the Raj Ghat where Mahatma Ghandi was cremated and take an invigorating rickshaw rIde through the streets of Old Delhi! GURUDWARA SHRI BANGLA SAHIB (Sikh Temple) is one of the most important historical and sacred pilgrimage destinations of the Sikh community in India and the most sacred among the destinations in Delhi. It was actually a Haveli or Bangla where Guru Hari Krishan, the eighth Sikh Guru of the Sikhs, stayed during his tour to Delhi in 1664. The Guru was entertained as a royal guest by Mirza Raja Jai Singh in this bangla. Later this bangla became the memoir of the Guru and was later converted to gurudwara. It is estimated that more than 10,000 visitors visit this Gurudwara every day. Overnight in Delhi

After an early breakfast, provIde in time transfer to railway station to board the train to Amritsar Train Details: Train Name & Name : Swarna Shatabadi / 12029 Departure from Delhi: 0720 Hrs Arrival at Amritsar: 1335 Hrs Proposed Class: AC chair car On arrival meet and assist by our representative and transfer to hotel. At the heart of the Amritsar, a long white wall greets you with a clock tower and pretty arched windows but not the slightest hint of the wonder hIdden beyond the central gate. Walk through and as you reach the top of the stops the Golden temples a suddenly reveled glorious an breathtaking with domes and parapets mirrored in a glistening lake, cloisters, shrines sacred tress and pilgrims ‘Saris’ fluttering in the light. Times stands still, words are few an in this beautiful oasis, spirituality becomes tangible. In the evening you will proceed to visit Golden Temple. Overnight in Amritsar

Morning after breakfast sightseeing of Amritsar which includes Amritsar resplendent Golden Temple, Spiritual Center of Sikh Faith, built by Guru Arjun in the late 16th Century. We will also visit Akal Takht, Jallianwala Bagh, India-Pakistan border at Wagha to view the Border Retreat Ceremony. Overnight at the Hotel. Golden Temple The Golden Temple Amritsar India (Sri Harimandir Sahib Amritsar) is not only a central religious place of the Sikhs, but also a symbol of human brotherhood and equality.The Golden Temple Amritsar India (Sri Harmandir Sahib Amritsar) has a unique Sikh architecture. The four entrances of this holy shrine from all four directions, signify that people belonging to every walk of life are equally welcome. Akal Takht Akal Takhat (Punjabi: Akāl Taḵẖt) means the Throne of the Immortal and is the highest political institution of the Sikhs. “Akal” means “The Timeless One” – another term for God. “Takhat” means “throne” in Persian. The Akal Takhat is an impressive building that sits directly in front of the causeway leading to the Golden Temple in Amritsar. Jalianwala Bagh Jallianvala Bagh Massacre, involved the killing of hundreds of unarmed, defenceless Indians by a senior British militry officer, took place on 13 April 1919 in the heart of Amritsar, the holiest city of the Sikhs, on a day sacred to them as the birth anniversary of the Khalsa. Jallianvala Bagh,. a garden belonging to the Jalla, derives name from that of the owners of this piece of land in Sikh times. Wagha Border (India – Pakistan Border) Every day of the year, just before sunset, a flag lowering ceremony takes place at the Wagah Border between India and Pakistan. The ceremony lasts for around 45 minutes in total. It starts with high patriotic spirits from sIdes of the border. Soldiers march towards the gate at the border, which is thrown open when they reach there. The soldiers salute each other and start lowering the flags. Overnight in Amritsar

name.S: Day 04 AMRITSAR- DHARAMSHALA (195kms/ 04 hours drive approx)

description.S: Morning after breakfast drive to Dharmshala. Dharamsala is beautifully located on a rIdge of the Dhauladhar range. The town rises in levels up the hill from a height of 1250 m to 2000 m. The snow line, not far away and the dramatic Dhauladhar Peaks rise above the town – far below are the misty plains. Overnight in Dharmshala

Explore McLeod Gang, a suburb of Dharamsala often referred to as “Little Lhasa” because it is the home to Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso a modern day “SIddhartha”, and the Tibetan Government in Exile. The Tibetan settlement of Dharamsala began in 1959, when His Holiness the Dalai Lama had to flee Tibet and the India Prime Minister allowed him and his followers to settle in McLeod Ganj (in Upper Dharmsala), a former colonial British summer picnic spot. Today there are many temples, monasteries and schools here. McLeod Ganj has also attracted many foreigners who wish to study Tibetan Buddhism encouraging tourism and commerce in the Tibetan Community. See Namgyal Monastery, the main monastery for monks training and the Tibetan Village School, which teaches lay children. Overnight in Dharamsala

name.S: Day 06 DHARMSHALA SHIMLA (239kms/ 05 hours drive approx)

description.S: Morning breakfast in the hotel later transfer to Shimla. After fresh up go for local sightseeing of Shimla. Shimla mosque built in 1830, Vice Regal lodge, Christ Church built in 1844 the Gaiety Theatre, The Scandal Point, Kaali Baari temple and Jakhoo temple. The evening is free to explore the famous shopping Plaza of the North. Overnight in Shimla.

Morning breakfast in the hotel later Excursion to Kufri. Kufri is famous for its Himalayan National Park, Poney and Yak RIde and One can see the endless Himalayan Panorama from Kufri, driving further from Kufri to Chail is exciting drive. Chail can be a better option and Later visit to The Highest cricket ground .Evening at Leisure. Overnight in Shimla

name.S: Day 08 SHIMLA – RISHIKESH (275kms/ 06 hours drive approx)

description.S: Morning after breakfast drive to Rishikesh. Rishikesh is virtually a town of saints, sages and scholars. Rishikesh is a rare religious center located on the right bank of river Ganga. There are a number of Ashrams where religious discourses are held. The place is also a renowned center for yoga teachings. Rishikesh is also an attraction for foreign pilgrims who want to know about Hinduism and who want to spend some time close to the Lord. Overnight in Rishikesh.

Rishikesh is a holy city for Hindus located in the foothills of the Himalaya in northern India. Legend states that Lord Rama dId penance here for killing Ravana, the demon king of Lanka. It is also known as the gateway to the Himalayas, Rishikesh is the starting point for traveling to the sites that form the Char Dham pilgrimage – Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri and Yamunotri, in Rishikesh visit the magnificent ashrams and famous Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula. After visit drive to HarIdwar. HarIdwar(Hardwar) has been derived from two words, ‘Har’ means Shiva, ‘Hari’ means Vishnu, and Dwar means gate. HarIdwar is thus the gateway to the two holy shrines of Shiva and Vishnu in Badrinath and Kedarnath, respectively. Places to See in HarIdwar are Har-ki-Pauri ghat is one of the most sacred Ghats in India as Maha arti is performed on this ghat every evening. HarIdwar is famous for its Ganges ceremony (Ganga Aarti) that is celebrated at 7 pm each night. Other places to see include Mayapuri and Kankhal, which are near HarIdwar.Mansa Devi is a temple located on top of a hill called the Bilwa Parvat. One can reached the temple, by the rope way or one can take the normal trekking route to the top. After visit drive back to Rishikesh for Overnight stay. Overnight in Rishikesh.

name.S: Day 10 RISHIKESH – DELHI (235kms/ 05 hours drive approx)

description.S: Morning after breakfast drive to Delhi. Also drive past INDIA GATE, the memorial of the First World War and the road that leads from there to RASHTRAPATHI BHAWAN – the resIdence of the PresIdent of India, which is flanked by the houses of Parliament and the Government Secretariat buildings. On arrival transfer to the hotel. Overnight in Delhi

Morning breakfast in the hotel later drive to airport to board the flight for Varanasi. Flight Option Flight Name and Number:SG- 116 (Spice Jet) Departure Time 0905hrs Arrival Time 1025hrs Upon arrival meet and greet by our representative and transfer to the Hotel. The Holy City Banaras, is one of the most important pilgrim sites in India and also a major tourist attraction. Situated on the banks of the sacred Ganges, Varanasi has been a center of learning and civilization for over 2000 years. Many come here to seek peace and tranquility of mind something which is greatly enhanced during a Benaras visit. Varanasi is a city of winding alleys with bustling markets, each specializing in something. Fabrics, metal ware, milk products, snacks, sweetmeats, handicrafts, wedding decorations, temple paraphernalia, bangles – Varanasi has it all. The bazaars are at their colourful best in the evening and best explored on foot and by cycle-rickshaw. The best way to end an evening in Varanasi is at Dasashwamedh Ghat, where you can watch priests perform the evening prayer to the Ganges. Evening, attend evening prayer at Dashawamedh Ghat. Overnight in Varanasi.

Early Morning Boat RIde in Varanasi. Sun rise at the holy river is a truly tranquil and breath taking sight with pilgrims standing waist‑deep in water, praying to the rising Sun. Later walk through the waterfront, from Assi Ghat to Dashashwamedh Ghat. It constitutes one half of the famous Panchatirthi pilgrimage, the visit to the five sacred fords. Although on this tour we are not going to do the prayers or ritual baths that are part of the pilgrimage, you will be able to see pilgrims participating in it. After visit drive back to hotel for Breakfast. After breakfast visit After breakfast visit the The Benaras Hindu University founded in 1916 and its famous Museum ‑ Bharat Kala Bhavan which houses one of the finest collection of Mughal miniature paintings and brocade textiles. The Bharat Mata and Durga Temple and see the famous Vishwanath temple with its spires covered with gold, dedicated to Shiva, the presIding deity of the city. Afternoon proceed for excursion tour of Sarnath. The place where the Buddha turned the Wheel of Law and delivered His First Sermon. See the Chowkandi and Dhamek Stupas, the ruins of 9th and 10th century monasteries and temples, the temple built by the Mahabodhi Society in 1931, and the Tibetan Temple. Visit the famous Sarnath Museum. Overnight in Varanasi.

Morning kept free for leisure. Breakfast in the hotel. Later transfer to airport to board the flight for Delhi. Flight Option Flight Name and Number: SG- 233 (Spice Jet) Departure Time 1100hrs Arrival Time 1225hrs Upon arrival visit LOTUS TEMPLE before transfer to the Hotel. The structure is made up of pure white marble The architect Furiburz Sabha chose the lotus as the symbol common to Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism and Islam. Adherents of any faith are free to visit the temple and pray or meditate. Around the blooming petals there are nine pools of water, which light up, in natural light. It looks spectacular at dusk when it is flood lit. Overnight in Delhi
Morning after breakfast, On time transfer to the International airport to board the flight for onward journey.

description.S: Meet and assist upon arrival and transfer to the hotel

After breakfast proceed with a sightseeing tour of Old and New Delhi. In Old city visit Red Fort built by Emperor Shah Jahan; Jama MasjId, one of the largest mosques in India; Raj Ghat- the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi and enjoy a walking tour in Chandni Chowk- the silver street of Delhi bustling with activity. In the New city visit Qutab Minar, the tallest stone tower in India; Humayun’s Tomb built in the Indo Persian style and a predecessor to The Taj Mahal in Agra; India Gate – A War Memorial Arch. Also drive past the PresIdent’s house, Parliament house, Government secretariat buildings and Connaught place – the heart of New Delhi and a busy shopping center. Overnight is at the hotel

Morning after breakfast. Transfer to the Airport to borad flighjt for Bhubaneshwar. On arrival half day Sightseeing of Bhubaneswar includes 11 th to 13 th century A.D lingaraj temple , rajarani temple, mukteswar temple, dhauli peace pagoda, 2nd century b.c jain monk caves at khandagiri and udaygiri,etc Overnight at Hotel.
Today after breakfast you will make an excursion to Ratnagir. Overnight at Hotel.
Today after breakfast you will make as drive to Baliguda. Overnigjht at Hotel.
Today after breakfast .you will make a visit to different Villages & Desai Kondh. Overnight at HOTEL.
After breakfast you will depart to Belghar area visit of a few Huttiya Kondha Tribal Villages & Weekly Market at Kothagarh.Lunch on the way .Dinner and Overnight at Hotel.
Drive to Onukudelli visit of weekly market of Bonda & Gadhaba Tribes. Visit of few Gadhaba Villages then Drive to Jeypore for Overnight at Hotel.
Visiter of Paraja Tribes at biggest market at Kundli. OVERNIGHT at Hotel.

Today you will visit Dhuruba Tribe,Laxmipur, Bondas Region.Also Visit Jagannath Temple & Tribal Museum at Koraput (The Jagannath Temple is a new temple built on 1972,Here Non Hindus are allowed insIde the Temples ,all activities are similar to Jagnnath Temple of Puri).Lunch on the way .Dinner and overnight at Hotel.
Today you will make a drive to Chilka visiting Taptapani.Overnight at HOTEL.
Today in the morning you will make a drive to Puri .iN THE EVENING YOU ASRE FREE ON THE BEACH.Overnight at Hotel.
Today you will make a full day City tour of Puri.(Jagnnath & all Temples&City Tour of Puri)& Konnark (The Sun Temple).Overnight at Hotel.
Today morning after breakfast transfer to Bhubaneshwar Airport to board flight to Delhi for onward Destination.

Title: Orissa Tour Package India: Explore Ancient Temples
Description: Explore the rich culture and heritage with our Orissa tour package in India. Visit temples, wildlife sanctuaries, & scenic landscapes on a memorable journey.
Additional_Information:
• Difficulty Level: Moderate to High – Suitable for experienced cyclists
  • Best Time to Visit: June to September
  • What to Bring: Comfortable biking gear, warm clothing, sunscreen, and personal essentials

Overview: This is a brief overview of the package.

description.S: On arrival in Bhubaneswar. Assistance on arrival and transfer to hotel. Rest of the day free for relax at hotel Bhubaneshwar, which means “The Lord of the Universe”, is the modern capital of the State of Orissa. Once the capital of the Kalinga Empire, there are several sites in the vicinity, which testifies the importance of the region far earlier than the 7th century, when the Kalinga kings started their rule over this region and beyond. Overnight in Bhubaneswar

Morning: guIded city tour of Bhubaneswar. Afternoon: Free for independent activities. Strewn with a multitude of temples of various sizes, the earliest temples built in Bhubaneswar are the Brahmeswar and the, Parasurameshwar temples of the 7th century. The latter is famous for its latticed windows. The Mukteswar built in the 10th century has exquisite toranas, the 11th Century temples of Rajarani Temple have fine and detailed carvings while the magnificent Linga Raja temple also of the 11th century (can seen only from outsIde by non Hindus ) is the finest representation of Kalinga art. Overnight in Bhubaneswar

Full day guIded excursion to Puri and Konark. Afternoon drive back to Bhubaneswar Puri (62kms from Bhubaneswar) ‑ one of the four Dhams of India, the abode of Lord Jagannath. Situated right on the shore of the Bay of Bengal, Puri has been a centre of pilgrimage since the days history could reckon. It is famous for the massive chariot-cars used in the annual Rath Yatra Procession. One of the most stunning symbols of religious architecture, the Sun Temple at Konark also known as the Black Pagoda is the crowning glory of Orissan temple art. Built in the 13th century, the entire temple was designed in the shape of a colossal chariot, carrying the Sun god, Surya, pulled by seven horses. The 24 giant wheels of the chariot symbolize the division of time. The temple is a brilliant chronicle in stone, with thousands of images including deities, heavenly damsels, and human musicians, lovers, dancers, birds, animals and a plethora of intricate geometrical decorative designs. Overnight in Bhubaneswar

Drive to Balliguda en route visiting typical Oriyan villages. Baliguda is in the district of Phulbani, through the beautiful countrysIde road full with small mountains of Sal forest, one of the entry points to the tribal highland of Orrisa. En-route visit typical Orissa villages. Arrive at the hotel in the evening. Overnight in Balliguda

Morning: Drive to Rayagada en route explores the villages of the primitive Kutia Kondh tribe. Proceed to explore the villages of the primitive Kutia kondh Tribes, once famous for the human sacrifice. Living in the mountain / forest cores are friendly tribal community. You can take small/ long trek as you wish. Overnight in Rayagada
Full day visit market in Kothagarh and visit villages of Desia Kondh tribe and Dongaria Kondh. Overnight in Rayagada

Morning: Drive to Jeypore en route visit Chatikona to witness the interesting and colorful weekly market on the Dongaria tribe. Later visit Jharia Paroja village. On arrival in Jeypore transfer to hotel This day this interesting ornamental Tribes come down from their mountain will known as Niayamgiri hill range. This is an unique opportunity to witness them before they come and mix with other community in the market, so we will take you 2/3 km from the market near the Niyamgiri hill, so to watch & enjoy these community coming down with different kinds of fruits, animal etc. Overnight in Jeypore
Morning: Excursion to Onkadelli to visit the weekly market of the Bonda tribe. Afternoon: Explore the tribal villages of the Gadaba tribe. Overnight in Jeypore

Morning proceed to witness the biggest tribal weekly market of Sanaparoja & Mali tribes in Kunduli 65 km away via Sunabeda. It is a very colorful market. Later drive down to Nandapur to visit village of Sanaparoja tribes. Visit village khilus. Saana Padar, Bda Padar with small trekking and later later drive down to Jeypore. You can also morning proceed to Gupteswar 70 km to visit the villages of very interesting dhuruba tribe. Visit and walk through villages of Ramanguda, Dogariguda, Silpader, Talur etc. There is an interesting tribe where the males like to put ornaments living in the border of Madhya Pradesh. Visit the Cave temple of lord Shiva in the hIdden mountain famous among the tribes. Later drive down to Nuagaon to witness the beautiful tribal weekly market of Sana Paroja and then back to hotel at evening. Overnight in Jeypore
Morning: Drive to Jagdalpur en route visiting the dyeing and terracotta work in Kotapad village. On arrival in Jagdalpur, check in at hotel. Overnight in Jagdalpur

Morning: Drive to Chitrakut en route visit the villages of Muria tribe and the weekly market. Afternoon: Visit a few villages and beautiful waterfall. A large section of Bastar is covered by forests full of trees such as Seesam, Sal, Bamboo and Teak. Bastar also plays home to a number of mountains, hills, caves, parks as well as waterfalls. In fact, the Lakes and Waterfalls in Bastar are major tourist attractions. Amongst the numerous lakes and waterfalls of this region, a place that you should not miss is Chitrakot Waterfalls, Bastar Chitrakot Waterfalls of Bastar is a gorgeous waterfall on Indravati River. It is located at a distance of 38 kms towards the west of Jagdalpur. The approximate height of Chitrakot Waterfalls is 100ft. The Chitrakot waterfalls are often regarded as the smaller version of the celebrated Nayagra waterfalls as the shape of it is that of a horseshoe. The rainbow colors of Chitrakot Waterfalls in Bastar, Chhattisgarh, India would mesmerize the tourists at the very first sight itself. Therefore, it is no surprise that Chitrakot Waterfalls is the prime attraction for all tourists. It is worth a watch especially in rainy season, between the months of July and October Overnight in Chitrakut
Drive to Kailash Cave in Kanger Valley and visit Bhadra tribal village. Overnight in Chitrakut
Morning: Drive to Narayanpur to watch the famous tribal artwork of Maria tribe of Narayanpur area and wooden work in Kondagaon. Evening: Witness the tribal dance at Kanker Overnight in Narayanpur
Morning: Drive to Raipur en route visit the villages of Maria tribe at the Gadbental area. Overnight in Raipur
Transfer to airport in time to connect onward flight

Overview: This is a brief overview of the package.

name.S: DAY 01 ARRIVE DELHI (Normal check-in time at hotel is 1400 Hrs)

description.S: Today arrival at Indira Gandhi international airport, meet and greet by our representative. Later, assistance and transfer to hotel. Delhi – the capital of India, is a fascinating city with complexities and contradictions, beauty and dynamism, where the past co-exists with the present. Many dynasties ruled from here and the city s rich in the architecture of its monuments. Delhi is not only the present metropolis of India but also a Necropolis. Because of its location, being on the banks of the River Yamuna, many cities have risen and fallen over the last five millenniums. Overnight in Delhi

Breakfast at hotel Morning: Sightseeing tour of Old Delhi. Drive pass historic RED FORT. Very near the Fort is the JAMA MASJId (FrIday Mosque), India’s largest mosque, also built by Shah Jahan, take an interesting rickshaw rIde through the famous bazaars of Chandni Chowk, which is adjacent to both the Fort and the Mosque. Also visit RAJ GHAT – the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi. Later sightseeing tour of New Delhi. Visit the QUTAB MINAR, a Tower of Victory which was built in the 12th century by Qutbuddin Aibak. Within its spacious courtyard stands the Iron Pillar, which dates back to the 4th century AD and bears a Sanskrit inscription in the Gupta style. The pillar has puzzled scientists, as its iron has not rusted in all these centuries. Also drive past INDIA GATE, the memorial of the First World War and the road that leads from there to RASHTRAPATHI BHAWAN – the resIdence of the PresIdent of India, which is flanked by the houses of Parliament and the Government Secretariat buildings. Overnight in Delhi (B)

After late breakfast day is free until provIde in time transfer to railway station to board the train to Sawai Madhopur. Train Details: Train Name / Number: Kota Janshatabdi / 12060 Departure from Delhi: 1320 Hrs Arrival at Sawai Madhopur: 1802 Hrs Proposed class: A/C Chair Car On arrival at Sawai Madhopur railway station meet and greet by our representative and transfer to Ranthambhore. On arrival check in at the hotel. With an area of 400 sq. km encompassing rocky hill crests which descend to open valleys between the Aravalli and Vindhya ranges, dotted with water pools and fruit trees, this park gets its name from the thousand year old fortress, which looms above the forest. Well known for the diurnal activity of tigers, Ranthambore is a very special and unusual area where a natural present meets a historical past. Gazelles, sambar, cheetal, chinkara, nilgai, langoor, wild bull, the elusive leopard and tiger abound this sanctuary. Dotted across the landscape are the crumbling ruins of its past glory, be it chatris or cupolas, like palaces or old guard posts, all of which reinforce the magical and ethereal quality of this great wilderness. Overnight in Ranthambhore (B/D)
Morning and evening game viewing at Ranthambhore National Park. Overnight in Ranthambhore (B/L/D)

name.S: DAY 05 RANTHAMBHORE / FATEHPUR SIKRI / AGRA (267 Kms. / 05-06Hrs)

description.S: Today you will transfer to Agra en-route visit of Fatehpur Sikri It is 38 Kms from Agra and often referred to as abandoned Moghul capital. This 16th century capital of Moghul emperor Akbar is a complex of forts, palaces and mosques built in sandstone. The city had to be deserted because of lack of water. The white marble Tomb of Sheikh Salim Chisti, Akbar’s spiritual adviser, is now observed as a Muslim pilgrimage spot here. Arrival Agra and transfer to hotel Agra is famous as the home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World – the Taj Mahal. The architectural splendour of the mausoleums, the fort and the palaces in Agra is a vivId reminder of the opulence of the legendary Mughal Empire. Agra was their capital for nearly a hundred years from 1564. A pleasant town, with a comparatively easy pace, Agra is known for its superb inlay work on marble and soapstone by artisans who are hereditary crafts persons. The city is also famous for its carpets, gold thread embroIdery and leather shoes Overnight in Agra (B)

In the morning transfer to visit Taj Mahal Taj Mahal – monuments of Love, (TAJ MAHAL REMAIN CLOSED ON EVERY FRIdAY ) which was built in the mIddle of the 17th century by the Moghul emperor Shah Jehan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Visit the Taj Mahal surely the greatest monument to love and one of the wonders of the modern world. Completed in 1652, skilled craftsmen from Persia, Turkey, France and Italy and some 20,000 labourers worked for 17 years to build this edifice, constructed by Emperor Shah Jehan as a mausoleum for his beloved queen Mumtaz Mahal. Marble was brought from Makrana, near Jodhpur and precious stones of onyx, amethyst, malachite, lapis lazuli, turquoise, jade, crystal and mother of pearl were carried to Agra from Persia, Russia, Afghanistan, Tibet, China and the Indian Ocean. In the afternoon visit Agra Fort, which stands like a crescent on the banks of the Jamuna River enclosed by forbIdding 20-meter high walls, with a 12- meter moat between them? Three successive Mughal emperors – Akbar, Jehangir and Shah Jehan – helped create this massive structure which contains Hindu and Muslim architecture. Later visit Itimad-Ud-Daulah. Itmad-Ud-Daulaha’s tomb was built by Empress Noor Jahan in memory of her father, Ghias-Ud-din Beg in 1622-25 AD. This ornate tomb is consIdered a precursor of the Taj Mahal. After visit provIde in time transfer to railway station to board the overnight train to Katni. Train Details: – Train Name / No Mahakoshal Express / 12190 Depart from Agra 1930 Hrs Arrival at Katni 0935 Hrs* ( *Next Morning) Proposed Class 2 tier ac sleeper Overnight in Train. (B)

name.S: DAY 07 ARRIVAL KATNI / BANDHAVGARH (100kms/ 03 hours approx)

description.S: Morning arrival at Katni railway station followed by transfer to Bandhavgarh. Arrival in Bandhavgarh and check-in at the hotel Bandhavgarh is probably India’s densest tiger park. Throughout the journey, this is your absolute best opportunity to see the tiger. With its 105 km2, the park is relatively small. It is a hilly park with 400 meters height difference from the highest to the lowest point. The park has several valleys where a score of small streams flowing. Eventually, all streams flows into the River Son and finally in the Ganges. The park’s highest point is 811 meters high hill, according to legend the place where the god Shiva placed his brother Laxman to scout the enemy in Sri Lanka. In Sanskrit means Bandhavgarh just “his brother continued.” ProvIde afternoon safari. Overnight in Bandhavgarh (L/D)
Morning and evening game viewing at Bandhavgarh National Park. Overnight in Bandhavgarh (B/L/D)

Morning breakfast in hotel later drive to Kanha. Kanha National park is located in Banjar and Halon valleys in the Mandla / Balaghat districts of the state of Madhya Pradesh. Kanha National Park is one of the India’s finest tiger reserves. It is spread more than 940 sq km in a horse shoe shaped valley bound by the spurs of the Mekal range the park presents a varies topography. ProvIde afternoon safari in Kanha National Park. Overnight in Kanha. (B/L/D)
Morning & afternoon enjoy safari in Kanha National Park. Overnight in Kanha. (B/L/D)

name.S: DAY 11 KANHA- NAGPUR(262 kms / 06 hour’s drive approx)- DELHI

description.S: Morning breakfast in the hotel later drive Nagpur airport to board the flight for New Delhi. Flight Details Sector Nagpur Delhi Flight Name and Number Indigo Airline 6E-136 Departure Details 1800 Hrs Arrival Details 1940 Hrs Proposed Class Economy Class Assistance upon arrival and transfer to the hotel for Overnight. Overnight in Delhi.
ProvIde in time transfer to International airport to board the flight for onwards journey

Name: In Search of Tigers

description.S: Meeting and assistance on arrival and transfer to the hotel

Breakfast at Hotel & transfer to airport to board flight to Baroda (9w-349/1015-1105 hrs).Arrive Baroda & tranfer to Hotel.Later proceed to chhota Udaipur to see tha Rathwa tribes in and around the Region.It is consIdered one of the most primitive tribal belt of Gujarat.After an early lunch drive byjeep to the triba village like Kol,Kharakwada,Timla, Devhat etc.Late evening return Baroda.

Morning ,In time transfer to airport to board the flight for Ahmedabad.On arrival, We drive to Utellia (78 kms-1.5 hrs),a feudal village clustered arround the medieval Place. Arrive and check into the Hotel.Overnight stay will be at utellia.

name.S: Day 04 Utellia-Excursion to Bharwad Tribal Village

description.S: The Bharwad Tribes,a pastoral people of the region, are by profession are Shepherds and cattkeman. Now leading a settled and no longer wonderers, The Bharwadi life of village. Know for strong likings to color, they paint there house primarily in blue,green and white.On your tour,visit these colorfull tribal people wondering in the neat land and perhaps few tribal homes to get an insIde into day-to-day tribal lifes. Some Bharwadi are now engaged in different occupation such as polishing and cutting of diamond. catch the steps that turn a handfull of dull looking opaque lamp into sparkling gems in your Camera.Also looking a local camel-breeding farm.producing a finest stock of Camels.Overnight stay will be at utellia.

After breakfast,We drive at Balaram.Located at about 155 Km to Ahmedabad, Balaram is a beautifull holy town.Situated amIdst lush green and picturesque forest area. Balaram offers an Ideal spot foe a day picnic from Ahmedabad.Enruote to Balaram,visit three amazing tourist attraction of Gujarat-Caleco Museum,Adalag Wav (step well)and Modhera Sun Temple.The Calico Museum one of the famous and important museums of Gujarat, exhibiting and extensive array of tribal fabrics of the Gujarat Step-wells, was built in 1499 by Royal families as a reliable source of water, throughout the year .The Modhera sun temple was built in 1026 AD during the reign of king Bhimdev 1 of Solanki dyntasty. The temple saId to resemble the fomous Konark Temple in Orissa. Arrive and check into the Balaram Palaces Resort,One of the most famous heritageresort of Gujarat. Overnight stay will be at Balaram Palaces Resort.

name.S: Day 06 Balaram- Excursion to the Gowala and Garacia Tribal Regions

description.S: Located arround the Hills bordering Gujarat and Rajasthan, the Gowala and Garacia are primarily sheephards, known for their unique culture and tradition.The Gowala and Garacia are second cousins of each other ,differing only in the manner of living. While the Gowala are more settled, yhe Garacia are still wanderers, and their women dress in slightly less ostentatious manner than the Gowala Females. Visit and see these tribes on your Gujarat tribal tour to get an insight into their unique tribal life.Also enjoy a private perfomance of tribal dance.

name.S: Day 07 Balaram – Patan – Little Rann of Kutch

description.S: Today, we drive to Patan. Once the capital of medieval Gujarat, Patan is known for its Hindu and Jain architecture like Rani-ki-Vav, Rani and Dhanderwad Jain Temple among many other attractions. Patan is also famous for patola (an intricate form of double ikkat weaving) sarees. Arrive Patan and visit one of the three families of patola weavers, known for their unique patola art. The fact that one patola sari can take up to six months to complete, proves that how difficult and demanding is the patola art. Also visit the famous 11th century Rani-ki-Vav (step well). All three families live close to this step well. Continue drive into the Little Rann of Kutch. Arrive and check into the Desert Courser Camp. Overnight stay will be at the Desert Camp.

Composed of marshy salt flats and inhospitable Terai, the Little Rann of Kutch separates Kutch from the rest of Gujarat. Home to endangered Asiatic Wild Ass, the area is known for its unique wildlife and birds. Rabari and Banjara are the two important tribes of the region. While the Rabari, the most nomadic of Gujarat’s tribes, constantly migrate in search for better grazing ground for their camels and sheep, the Banjara and other tribes have settled here. Overnight stay will be at the Desert Camp.

name.S: Day 09 Little Rann of Kutch – Bhuj

description.S: Today, we enjoy a daylong drive westward into the bleak countrysIde of Kutch towards Bhuj, the region’s capital. If it’s the season when the Rabari migrate, then our journey may be enlivened by meeting a group of them, along the way. Arrive and check into the hotel for 4 nights, in order to know the unique tribes of the region. Overnight stay will be at Bhuj.

name.S: Day 10 Bhuj – Little Rann of Kutch

description.S: Known as the ‘Melting Pot of Tribes’, the Rann of Kutch region is home to many unique tribes, known for their fascinating and colorful culture and traditions. The major tribes of the region are the Megwar, Samma, Jat, Mutwa, Ahir and Rabari. Enjoy daily excursions to the wonderful tribal regions of the barren and inhospitable Rann of Kutch and catch the various facets of tribal life in your camera. Also explore Bhuj, which was devastated by the earthquake that struck in January 2001. Visit and discover the Old City. See the Aina (Old) and Prag (New) Mahals (palaces) and visit the Bhartiya Folk Museum with its exhibits pertaining to local tribal life. Also meet an artist who is one of three people continuing to paint in the unique and distinct Rogan style. Overnight stay in Bhuj.
Excursion to the another tribal regions of this area
Excursion to the another tribal regions of this area
Morning at leisure. On time transfer to Bhuj airport to board the flight for Mumbai. On arrival, you will be met and transferred to hotel. Overnight stay will be at Mumbai.
In time transfer to international airport / railway station to board flight / train for onward destination with interesting memories of Gujarat Tribal Tour.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in Chennai, you will be met and transferred to your hotel.
  • In the afternoon, embark on a sightseeing tour to explore the cultural richness of South India.
  • Chennai, originally a British settlement, still retains a blend of traditional lifestyle and colonial charm.
  • Visit key sites like the Kapaleeswarar Temple, a stunning example of Dravidian architecture dating back to 1250 AD, and the Parthasarathy Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
  • Explore Fort St. George, built in 1640 AD, the first British bastion in India, and St. Thomas Mount, the site of the martyrdom of St. Thomas in 72 AD.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out from the hotel and drive to Kanchipuram, one of India’s seven sacred cities.
  • Historically, it served as the capital of the Pallavas and later the Cholas and the Vijayanagar Rayas.
  • Visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, known for its towering 57-meter Rajagopuram, and the Kamakshi Amman Temple, one of the three holy sites dedicated to Shakti worship in India.
  • Later, drive to Mamallapuram, and upon arrival, check into the hotel. The rest of the day is free for leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, enjoy a sightseeing tour of Mamallapuram.
  • Visit the Shore Temple, one of the oldest in India, dedicated to both Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu.
  • Explore the Five Rathas, monolithic temples carved from a single rock, and Arjuna's Penance, the world’s largest bas-relief. This 27m x 9m relief showcases an array of divine figures and creatures.
  • The rest of the day is free for leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Pondicherry. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, enjoy a sightseeing tour of this former French colony.
  • Visit Aurobindo Ashram, a center for spiritual development and the synthesis of yoga and modern science.
  • Also, visit Auroville, a universal township founded by Shree Aurobindo and The Mother in 1926 to promote peaceful living and spiritual growth.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out and drive to Thanjavur.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel, followed by a sightseeing tour. Known as the Rice Bowl of Tamil Nadu, Thanjavur is home to several historic temples.
  • Visit the Brihadeeswara Temple, an architectural marvel of the Chola dynasty, famous for its towering central dome and massive monolithic stone slab.
  • Also, explore the Thanjavur Palace and Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses over 30,000 manuscripts.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out and drive to Tiruchirapalli.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel, followed by a sightseeing tour.
  • Visit the Rock Fort, a massive rock with a temple perched atop, offering panoramic views of the city.
  • Explore the Rock Fort Temple and Srirangam, an island town known for the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, one of the largest Vaishnavite temples in South India.
  • The temple complex is surrounded by seven walls and features 21 towering gopurams.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Madurai.
  • On arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the magnificent Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, famous for its towering gopurams and intricate carvings.
  • Also, explore the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, an Indo-Saracenic architectural wonder built in the 17th century.
  • Visit Vandiyur Mariamman Tank, a large temple tank with a mandapam in the center.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

Check-out of the hotel and transfer to the airport in time to board flight for Chennai. Arrive Chennai and connect flight for Bangalore. Assistance on arrival and transfer to hotel. Later proceed for sightseeing tour of Bangalore, one of the most pleasant cities of India takes in the central area which is studded with beautifully laId out parks, gardens, wIde tree-lined avenues, imposing buildings and lively bazaars. Bangalore is famous for the VIdhan Soudha which is one of the India’s most spectacular buildings, built in granite in the neo-DravIdian style of architecture. The Cubban Park is a beautifully landscaped; full of flowering trees and covers the park is the lung of the city an area of 120 hectares. The park is the lung of the city and was laId out in 1864. Some of the other attractions in Bangalore include the Lalbagh Gardens, the Tipu Sultan’s Palace and the Bull Temple, one of the Bangalore’s oldest temples.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Mysore, with a stop at Srirangapatna, the summer palace of Tipu Sultan.
  • Explore the island fortress, which is surrounded by the river Cauvery.
  • Upon arrival in Mysore, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, visit the Maharaja’s Palace, a stunning example of Indo-Saracenic architecture.
  • Explore the Jaganmohan Palace, now an art gallery, and the Brindavan Gardens, famous for its colorful lights and dancing fountains.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out of the hotel and drive to Hassan.
  • En-route, visit Shravanabelagola, a small village known for its massive Jain statue of Gomateshwara.
  • Upon arrival in Hassan, check in at the hotel.
  • Later, visit the historic sites of Belur and Halebid.
  • Belur is famous for the Chennakesava Temple, known for its intricate carvings.
  • Halebid was the ancient capital of the Hoysala Empire and is home to the Hoysaleswara Temple.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Hassan – Bangalore (187 km / 4 hrs) – Bangalore – Mumbai (Flight: 9W 418 – 1630 / 1805 hrs)

description.S:
• Check out from the hotel and drive to Bangalore.
  • Upon arrival, transfer to the airport for your flight to Mumbai.
  • On arrival in Mumbai, proceed directly to the international airport for your onward journey.
