Overview: Experience the spiritual richness and architectural beauty of South India with our South India Temple Tour Package. South India is home to some of the most revered and historic temples, known for their intricate architecture, grand rituals, and divine atmosphere. From the famous Meenakshi Temple in Madurai to the temple town of Kanchipuram, this tour will take you on a spiritual and cultural journey through Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and Kerala, offering a glimpse into the ancient practices and traditions of Hinduism.

description.S: • Upon arrival, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel for check-in.

• Start your day with a tour of Old Delhi, exploring its rich history.
  • Visit the iconic Red Fort, built by Emperor Shah Jahan after he moved his capital from Agra.
  • Next, head to the Jama Masjid, one of the largest mosques in India. Continue to Rajghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi.
  • In the afternoon, explore New Delhi with visits to the Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, and the Chhatarpur Temple, known for its serene atmosphere.
  • Discover Humayun's Tomb, an architectural masterpiece believed to be the inspiration for the Taj Mahal, and the Bahai Lotus Temple, a symbol of unity and peace for all faiths.
  • Enjoy an evening at leisure.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Check out of your hotel and travel to Mandawa, arriving in the afternoon.
  • Mandawa is famous for its painted havelis (mansions) in the Shekhawati region. It is known as an open-air gallery due to its stunning frescoes.
  • After checking in, enjoy a leisurely evening exploring this unique area.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• After breakfast, check out and proceed to Bikaner.
  • Upon arrival, check in at your hotel.
  • Visit Junagarh Fort, built in 1593, which stands as a striking example of Rajasthani architecture, with beautiful palaces within its walls.
  • Explore Lallgarh Palace, a grand structure built by Maharaja Ganga Singh in memory of his father, featuring beautiful lattice and filigree work.
  • Spend the evening at leisure.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Check out and drive to Khimsar, with a stop at Deshnok to visit the Karni Mata Temple, known for its sacred rats.
  • Upon arrival in Khimsar, check in at the Khimsar Fort, which now operates as a heritage hotel.
  • Relax and enjoy the hospitality of this historic fort.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, set out on a scenic drive to Jaisalmer, passing through Osian, an oasis with beautiful Jain and Brahmanical temples.
  • Arrive in Jaisalmer and check in at your hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Explore the golden city of Jaisalmer, which rises from the desert like a golden mirage.
  • Visit Jaisalmer Fort, which houses the entire township within its ramparts, and admire the narrow lanes lined with havelis, Jain temples, and interconnected palaces.
  • Discover Patwon-ki-Haveli, an exquisite example of Rajasthani architecture.
  • Visit the Sam Sand Dunes for a camel safari to experience the vast desert.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Check out and drive to Jodhpur.
  • After arriving and checking in, visit Mehrangarh Fort, an imposing structure perched on a hill, offering stunning views of the city.
  • Also visit Jaswant Thada, a beautiful royal cenotaph built in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II.
  • Enjoy the local market in the evening.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Drive to Rohetgarh and check in at your hotel.
  • In the afternoon, embark on a jeep safari to explore the Bishnoi villages.
  • The Bishnois are environmentalists who have been preserving the local wildlife for centuries.
  • Visit the villages of craftsmen such as potters, weavers, and metalworkers.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Drive to Udaipur, with a visit to the Ranakpur Jain Temples en route.
  • These temples are renowned for their intricate carvings and beautiful architecture.
  • Upon arrival in Udaipur, check in at your hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Explore Udaipur, the 'City of Dawn,' nestled around tranquil lakes and surrounded by lush hills.
  • Visit the City Palace, a magnificent architectural marvel overlooking Lake Pichola.
  • Discover Jagdish Temple, a stunning Indo-Aryan temple built in 1651, and Sahelion-ki-Bari, a beautiful garden with fountains and marble elephants.
  • Enjoy a boat ride on Lake Pichola, where you'll visit Jag Mandir and the Lake Palace.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out and drive to Pushkar, arriving in the afternoon.
  • Check in at your hotel and later visit Pushkar Lake, a sacred site associated with Lord Brahma.
  • Explore the local market and the Brahma Temple, one of the few temples dedicated to this deity.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out and drive to Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan.
  • Upon arrival, check in at your hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the City Palace, a stunning blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture.
  • Explore Jantar Mantar, an astronomical observatory built in 1726.
  • Drive to the Palace of Winds (Hawa Mahal), a five-story palace with a unique façade designed for the royal ladies to observe street life.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Embark on an excursion to Amber Fort, situated on a hill and accessible by elephant ride.
  • The fort houses the Marble Palace, Temple of Victory, and Hall of Mirrors.
  • In the afternoon, enjoy free time for leisure or shopping.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out and drive to Agra, with a visit to Fatehpur Sikri en route.
  • Explore the abandoned capital of Emperor Akbar, a fascinating site with architectural wonders.
  • Continue your journey to Agra and check in at your hotel.
  • Rest of the day at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

Overview: Experience the grandeur of India’s royal past with our Royal Delhi, Jaipur & Agra Tour Package. This package takes you through three of the most iconic cities in India – Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra. Explore majestic forts, palaces, and architectural marvels, and immerse yourself in the rich culture and history of India’s royal heritage. From the bustling streets of Delhi to the romantic Taj Mahal in Agra and the royal palaces of Jaipur, this tour offers an unforgettable experience of India's regal legacy.

description.S: • Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel.

• In the morning, embark on a tour of Old Delhi, a city rich in history and culture.
  • Your first stop is the Red Fort, built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan when he moved his capital from Agra.
  • Next, visit Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque.
  • Continue to Rajghat, the memorial for Mahatma Gandhi.
  • In the afternoon, explore New Delhi, including a visit to Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, constructed in 1191 AD.
  • You will also visit the serene Chhatarpur Temple, followed by a stop at Humayun’s Tomb, which is believed to have inspired the Taj Mahal.
  • The Bahai Temple, also known as the Lotus Temple, will be your final stop.
  • It is open to all faiths and serves as a place for peace and meditation.
  • The evening is free for leisure.
  • Stay overnight at the hotel.

• In the morning, begin your journey to Jaipur. Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, take a sightseeing tour of Jaipur.
  • Visit the City Palace, which houses several palaces and museums showcasing collections from the princely era.
  • Explore the Jantar Mantar, an outdoor observatory built in 1726 by King Jai Singh, which features instruments of remarkable precision.
  • End the tour with a visit to Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, famous for its façade of windows and latticed screens.

• In the morning, take an excursion to Amber Fort, located on a hill.
  • Experience an elephant ride to enter the fort, which houses the Marble Palace, the Temple of Victory, and the Hall of Mirrors.
  • The afternoon is free for you to explore Jaipur’s vibrant bazaars.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After an early breakfast, depart for Agra, stopping en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, the former capital of Emperor Akbar, abandoned due to water shortages.
  • Upon reaching Agra, check-in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the Taj Mahal, a stunning symbol of eternal love, built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • You will also visit Agra Fort, where you can enjoy breathtaking views of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower across the Yamuna River.

• After breakfast, transfer to the railway station for your train journey to Jhansi.
  • Upon arrival, drive to Khajuraho and check in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, enjoy a sightseeing tour of the famous temples of Khajuraho.
  • These temples, built between 950 and 1050 AD, are renowned for their extraordinary architecture and sculptures.
  • Visit the Kandariya Mahadeo Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, and other notable temples including Chausath Yogini, Vishwanath, Lakshmana, and Devi Jagadamba.

• Check out from your hotel and transfer to the airport for a flight to Varanasi.
  • Upon arrival, you will be assisted and transferred to your hotel.
  • In the afternoon, visit the Vishwanath Temple, also known as the Golden Temple, which was erected by Rani Ahalayabai Holkar and has a gold-plated spire.
  • Explore the Bharat Mata Temple, dedicated to Mother India, and the Tulsi Manas Temple, dedicated to Lord Rama.
  • The evening is free for you to wander through the local markets.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Early in the morning, take a boat ride on the Ganges River, experiencing the spiritual atmosphere.
  • Later, take a trip to Sarnath, an important Buddhist site, where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon.
  • Visit the Dhamek Stupa and the nearby Sarnath Museum, which houses the famous Ashoka Pillar.
  • Afterward, check out from your hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight back to Delhi.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at your hotel.
• Check out from your hotel and transfer to the international airport for your onward flight.

Overview: Explore the timeless beauty and cultural heritage of India with our Classical Delhi, Jaipur, Agra, Khajuraho & Varanasi Tour Package. This carefully crafted tour offers a rich blend of royal grandeur, architectural marvels, spiritual exploration, and cultural experiences. From the historical landmarks of Delhi to the world-famous Taj Mahal in Agra, the stunning temples of Khajuraho, and the spiritual heart of India, Varanasi, this tour takes you through the best of India’s cultural and historical treasures.

description.S: • Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be warmly welcomed and transferred to your hotel.

• Start the day with a guided tour of Old Delhi, a city with deep historical roots.
  • Your first visit will be the Red Fort, constructed by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan when he moved his capital from Agra.
  • Next, visit the Jama Masjid, one of the largest mosques in India.
  • Continue to Rajghat, the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi.
  • In the afternoon, explore New Delhi, starting with the Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, built in 1191 AD.
  • Visit Chhatarpur Temple, a popular Hindu temple known for its peaceful and serene atmosphere.
  • You’ll also visit Humayun’s Tomb, believed to have been designed by his widow, which influenced later Mughal tombs, including the Taj Mahal.
  • Conclude the day with a visit to the Bahai Temple, a lotus-shaped structure open to all faiths, ideal for meditation and tranquility.

• Check out from the hotel and drive to Jaipur. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, enjoy a sightseeing tour of Jaipur.
  • Visit the City Palace, a stunning complex with palaces and museums filled with royal collections.
  • Next, explore the Jantar Mantar, an astronomical observatory built by King Jai Singh in 1726, featuring precision instruments that continue to make accurate predictions.
  • Lastly, visit the Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, a five-story structure with a beautiful façade of windows and latticed screens.

• In the morning, embark on an excursion to Amber Fort, perched on a hill.
  • Enjoy an elephant ride to enter the fort, which includes the Marble Palace, Temple of Victory, and the Hall of Mirrors.
  • Spend the afternoon exploring the vibrant bazaars of Jaipur.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Check out from the hotel and drive to Ranthambore.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • Ranthambore National Park is renowned for its tiger population and offers one of the best opportunities to see these majestic creatures in their natural habitat.
  • The park, covering nearly 400 sq. km, is nestled between the Aravali and Vindhya mountain ranges.
  • In the afternoon an exciting Jeep safari in the park.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Start your day early with a Jeep safari in the national park.
  • Afterward, enjoy another Jeep safari in the afternoon to further explore the park’s wildlife.
  • The evening is free for relaxation.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, transfer to the Sawai Madhopur railway station to board the train to Bharatpur.
  • Upon arrival, you will be met by a naturalist for a bird-watching tour at Keoladeo Ghana National Park (Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary), known for its diverse birdlife, including the rare Siberian cranes.
  • After the birding tour, proceed to Agra, stopping en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, the deserted capital city of Emperor Akbar.
  • Upon arrival in Agra, check in at the hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Begin your day with a visit to the iconic Taj Mahal, built by Emperor Shah Jahan as a tribute to his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Also explore Agra Fort, which offers one of the most magnificent views of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower.
  • Visit other sites like Itmad-ud-Daulah, often referred to as the 'Baby Taj.'

  • Later in the afternoon, enjoy another Jeep safari to explore more of the park’s wildlife.

Overview: Over 100 national parks and wildlife sanctuaries call India their home beckoning nature buffs and thrill-seekers. Whether it's prowling around the tiger-dense forests of Ranthambore and Bandhavgarh, following the paths of elephants in Periyar, or watching birds in Bharatpur's paradise, India caters to each wildlife admirer's taste. These excursions mix thrills, learning, and preservation efforts letting folks see amazing life variety while aiding its safeguarding.

description.S: Meet on arrival and transfer to hotel.

Morning proceed for a sightseeing tour of the Old Delhi – a multi – layered city. Our first stop is the Red Fort built by the great Mughal Emperor Shah Jehan when he shifted his capital from Agra. A short drive brings us to the Great Mosque – The Jama MasjId. Drive on to see the memorial built for Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat. Afternoon Sightseeing tour of New Delhi includes a visit to the Qutub Minar – the tallest stone tower in India built in 1191 AD. Chhatarpur Temple – the most popular Hindu temple with blissful tranquility and serene ambience. Continue to Humayun’s Tomb believed to have been designed by his wIdow.  Its plan is based on the description of Islamic paradise gardens and is known to have inspired the Taj Mahal and many later Mughal tombs. Also visit the Bahai Temple – a lotus shaped structure. It is made of marble, cement, dolomite and sand. It is open to all faiths and is an Ideal place for meditation and obtaining peace and tranquility. Check-out of the hotel and transfer to the railway station in time to board overnight train to Bikaner. Overnight on board

Meeting and assistance on arrival and transfer to Gajner Palace. Arrive and check-in at the Gajner Palace. Rest of the day at leisure to explore the surrounding of the Palace. You can explore the estate on Buggies (Horse Carriages) or on open jeeps. Alternatively you can go for nature walk in the nearby forest. Overnight at the hotel.

Morning proceed for a sightseeing tour of Bikaner city visiting the Junagarh Fort, This fort was built by Raja Rai Singhji, the sixth ruler of Bikaner, who ruled form 1571 to 1612 AD. Raja Rai Singhji could Marshal the revenues of a Kingdom increased by the conquest of half Marwar and grant of half Gujrat and made use of ample funds from Jodhpur and Western Deccan for the construction of this fort. Devi Kund Sagar is situated 8 km in the east of city. The members of ruling family of Bikaner subsequent to Jet Singh, the great grandson of Rao Bikaji, have been cremated here.On the sIdes of reservoir of water lie the Royal cenotaphs of rulers of Bikaner dynasty from Rao Kalyan Singhji to last Maharaji Karni Singhji as well as those of their wives and other important members of families.There are cenotaphs (Chhatries) of 22 SATIES of royal family prior to Maharaja Gaj Sigh Ji (1745-1787). There is also one cenotaph of a SATA (male sati) of a ruler.The architecture of the cenotaphs is the prime attraction of this place. Maharaja Surat Singh’s Chhatri is built entirely in white marble with spectacular Rajput paintings on its ceiling. Close by is a Dargah of Rustal Ali Shah Peer which is held in high esteem by muslim community and other people. Later in the afternoon proceed for sightseeing of Deshnoke Temple. Situated en route to Jodhpur , the temple is dedicated to Karni Mata -an incarnation of Durga. The temple has fascinating huge silver gates and marble carvings that were donated by Maharaja Ganga Singhji The most attractive feature of temple are the rodents who scamper freely within the premises and if one touches your feet its consIdered auspicious. They are regarded  sacred and devotees buy prasad (feeding) to offer to them. Evening at leisure. Overnight at the hotel.

Check-out of the hotel and drive to Mandawa. Arrive and check-in at Hotel Castle Mandawa. Rest of the day at leisure to explore the quaint town full of Havelis with beautiful frescos. Overnight at the hotel.

Morning drive to Nawalgarh Founded in the 18th Century by Nawal Singh, it has some of the finest frescos in the Shekhawati region. A huge fort with colourful bazaar and numerous havelis with elaborate architecture makes it an interesting destination for a 1day / 1 night stay. There are a few prominent havelis like Anandilal Poddar Haveli, Aath Haveli, Hodh Raj Patodia Haveli etc., which are to be visited, and so are the two forts and the palace hotel Roop Niwas that is a beautiful heritage property and is renovated with modern facilities. The Palace offers spacious painted rooms, Luxurious interiors, graceful hospitality and great thematic evenings with sumptuous cuisine. The registered painting in their Art Gallery is a treat to the visuals. Evening return to Mandawa. Overnight at the hotel.

Morning drive to Dundlod. The Fort of Dundlod is an embodiment of cultural amalgamation of Rajputana and Mughal School of Art and Architecture. Its motif of flowers and foliage, minarets, mythological paintings, archaic furniture, wall hangings of arrows and shields have remained unchanged since hoary past. Here commercialism of artificial world could not slip in. Staying in Dundlod Fort is almost like living through the days of James Tod who described the splendors of Rajasthan. On every dawn the first ray of the sun befalls over the fort as an eternal bliss to the land of mystique and charisma. Later return to Mandawa. Overnight at the hotel.

name.S: Day 08 Mandawa – Jaipur (Drive: 151 km / 3 ½ hrs)

description.S: Check-out of the hotel and drive to Jaipur. Arrive Jaipur and check-in at the hotel. The Rose Pink city founded by Maharaja Jai Singh II (1693-1743), is the capital of Rajasthan. It is a major attraction for the first-time visitor. Jaipur, is surrounded on all sIdes by rugged hills, crowned with forts & enclosed by embattled walls. Houses with latticed windows line the streets with their rose pink colour lending enchantment to the scene which is salmost magical at sunset. The Old City (Known as the Pink City) is a great place to wander around . The whole city was painted in Pink colour by Maharaja Man Singh II when Prince of Wales, later Edward VII, visited Jaipur in 1876. Today, every home with in the city is obliged by law to maintain his facade. The City is laId out in a grId pattern. It is a very well planned city and was designed by a Young Bengali, an engineer and scholar by the name “VIdyadhar Bhattacharya”. Jaipur was and remains the only city in the world symbolising the nine divisions of the universe, through nine rectangular sectors subsIding to, Jaipur is a royal city, & this is its most noticeable aspect, small Buildings & festivals testify to it. Jaipur & its surroundings are rather like an endless museum. The city also offers an endless variety of crafts. Jewellers here still fashion the beautiful enamel-on-gold pendants, studded on the reverse with precious stones or pearls & turquoise that one sees in miniature paintings. Jaipur’s lacquer bangles are famous all over the world. Arrive Jaipur and check-in at the hotel. Evening at leisure to explore the local market. Overnight at the hotel.

Morning Proceed for an excursion to Amber fort. The Amber Fort in Rajasthan built in 1592 by Raja Man Singh, is one of the finest examples of Rajput architecture. Perched high on a barren rIdge, it commands extensive views over a deep narrow valley and the wIder plains beyond. The building was finally completed in the early18th century when the threat of Mughal domination was receding. Amber was once, the capital of the Mina tribes, believed to be the original inhabitants of this region. Located up on the hills that surround Jaipur, the fort, sprawled along the Maotha Lake, boasts of a massive complex gateways, courts, stairways and pillared pavilions, and palaces that recall the glory and wealth, of Amber’s association with the Mughals. This complex was built by Raja Man Singh, Mirza Raja Jai Singh and Sawai Jai Singh, over a period of about two centuries. Later in the day proceed for a city tour of Jaipur visiting The City Palace – a visitors delight. Within the walls are several Palaces and museums resplendent with collections of the princely era. Outdoor Observatory – the Jantar Mantar- built in 1726 by Jai Singh, a notable astronomer King. It houses instruments of astonishing accuracy, which give accurate predictions to this day. Drive to the Palace of Winds (Hawa Mahal) – a five story high Palace having a facade of windows and latticed screens which allowed the Ladies of the Court, in bygone days, to sit and view the streets of the city.

name.S: Day 10 Jaipur – Delhi (Drive: 265 km / 5 ½ hrs)

description.S: Check-out of the hotel and drive to Delhi. Arrive Delhi and transfer directly to the International airport in time to board flight for onward destination.

Name: Painted Havelis of Sekhawati
Title: Sekhawati Havelis Tour: Delhi, Bikaner, Mandawa, Jaipur
Description: Explore the stunning Sekhawati Havelis in Delhi, Bikaner, Mandawa, and Jaipur. Experience India’s rich culture and architecture with Eaze Tours. Book Now!
Additional_Information:
• Difficulty Level: Moderate to High – Suitable for experienced cyclists
  • Best Time to Visit: June to September
  • What to Bring: Comfortable biking gear, warm clothing, sunscreen, and personal essentials
  • Travel insurance is highly recommended for this tour
Whats_Included:
• Tour to Antelope Canyon X and Horseshoe Bend
  • Driver/Guide
  • Bottled water, soda, fruit and snacks
  • Hotel pick-up and dropoff by airconditioned vehicle
  • All Fees and Taxes
  • Gratuities (optional)
  • Lunch
Overview: This is a brief overview of the package.

description.S:
• Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be greeted and assisted before being transferred to your hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, embark on a sightseeing tour of Old and New Delhi.
  • Visit Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century.
  • Explore Raj Ghat and Shanti Vana, the cremation sites of Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru.
  • Drive through Chandni Chowk, once a grand avenue of Shah Jahan, and witness the Red Fort, a symbol of Mughal power built in 1648.
  • Continue the tour, visiting key landmarks such as:
    • India GatePresident’s PalaceHumayun’s TombQutub MinarRed Fort (mentioned again for emphasis)

name.S: Delhi to Cochin and Mararikulam (Flight: S2 145 – 0945 / 1445 hrs)

description.S:
• Check out from the hotel.
  • Transfer to the airport for your flight to Cochin.
  • Upon arrival in Cochin, receive a warm greeting.
  • Transfer to Mararikulam.
  • Check in at your resort.
  • Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the resort.

• Enjoy a relaxing day at the beach.
  • Stroll along stunning golden sandy shores that stretch endlessly.
  • Unwind in the perfect coastal environment.
  • Stay overnight at the resort for a peaceful retreat.

• Another day of relaxation at Marari Beach.
  • Take in the peaceful surroundings.
  • Enjoy the soothing atmosphere of the beach.
  • Overnight stay at the resort.

• Check out of the resort.
  • Drive to Kovalam, renowned for its beautiful beaches.
  • Upon arrival, check in at your beach resort.
  • The rest of the day is free for leisure.
  • Overnight at the resort.

• In the morning, visit the capital city of Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum), meaning 'the abode of Anantha,' referring to the sacred serpent on which Lord Vishnu reclines.
  • Explore the grand Sri Padmanabhaswamy Temple, known for its towering gopuram and stunning Dravidian architecture.
  • Visit the Napier Museum, which houses priceless bronze artifacts.
  • Explore the Chitralaya Art Gallery, featuring both Indian and international paintings.
  • Take a stroll through the Trivandrum Public Park, and explore the Natural History Museum located on its grounds.
  • Return to Kovalam for the evening at leisure.
  • Overnight at the resort.

• Spend the day at leisure, relaxing on the beach and enjoying the tranquil surroundings.
  • Overnight at the resort.

• Another day at leisure to enjoy the beach and relax.
  • Overnight at the resort.

• Check out from the resort and drive to Trivandrum Airport for your flight to Delhi.
  • Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be assisted and transferred to the International Airport for your onward journey.

Name: Enchanted Beaches
LocationDescription: Delhi – Cochin – Mararikulam – Kovalam – Trivendrum - Delhi
Title: Explore Exotic Beaches in India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore India's exotic beaches with Eaze Tours, featuring Delhi, Cochin, Mararikulam, Kovalam, and Trivandrum for a memorable coastal journey. Book Now!
Additional_Information:
• Best Time to Visit: November to March for pleasant weather and vibrant beach activities.
  • Ideal For: Couples, families, solo travelers, and adventure enthusiasts.
  • Popular Destinations: Goa, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Kerala, Lakshadweep, Pondicherry, and Gokarna.
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation: Beach resorts, boutique hotels, or eco-friendly stays.
  • Activities: Snorkeling, scuba diving, and beach yoga sessions.
  • Guided Tours: Explore local attractions, villages, and cultural spots.
  • Dining: Fresh coastal cuisine with local flavors.
  • Transportation: Convenient transfers to and from the beach locations.
Overview: From the sun-kissed shores of Goa to the serene sands of Andaman, India’s beaches are a paradise for travelers. You can unwind on tranquil beaches, indulge in thrilling water sports, or explore the rich coastal culture. Each destination promises a unique and unforgettable experience.

description.S: • Met on arrival and transfer to hotel.

• Begin your journey in Mumbai, discovering its bustling markets, colonial architecture, and the iconic Gateway of India.
  • Half day city tour of Mumbai will include a visit to the Prince of Wales Museum, Marine Drive, Mani Bhawan (Gandhi House), Flora Fountain, Kamla Nehru Park, and finally to the Hanging Gardens.
  • Experience the vibrant nightlife and explore the culture-rich city.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and transfer to the airport in time to board the flight for Bangalore.
  • Assistance on arrival and transfer to the hotel.
  • Later, proceed for a sightseeing tour of Bangalore, one of India’s most pleasant cities.
  • Explore the central area, known for its beautifully laid-out parks, gardens, wide tree-lined avenues, imposing buildings, and lively bazaars.
  • Visit the Vidhana Soudha, one of India’s most spectacular buildings, constructed in granite with neo-Dravidian architectural style.
  • Discover Cubbon Park, a beautifully landscaped area with flowering trees, covering 120 hectares, and known as the lung of the city, established in 1864.
  • Explore other notable attractions like the Lalbagh Gardens, Tipu Sultan’s Palace, and the Bull Temple, one of the oldest temples in Bangalore.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and drive to Hassan, en-route visit Shravanbelagola, a small village nestled between two hillocks.
  • Arrive in Hassan and check-in at the hotel.
  • Later, visit Belur & Halebid.
  • Belur – Situated on the banks of the Yagachi River, Belur was the capital of the Hoysala Empire 800 years ago. The town is home to one of the greatest monuments of medieval India, the 12th-century Chennakesava Temple, which commemorates the victory of the Hoysalas over the Cholas in the Battle of Talakad. The temple’s exterior is adorned with intricate sculptures and friezes, while its interior features exquisite panels and richly carved pillars. A tall stone pillar in the temple courtyard is balanced only by its center of gravity.
  • Halebid – Halebid, once the capital of the Hoysala Empire known as Dwarasamudra, was founded in the early 11th century AD. After being raided by the Delhi Sultanate armies in 1311 and 1327, the city was deserted and came to be known as Halebid or the Old Capital. The Hoysaleswara Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is a prominent surviving structure from the ancient city.
  • In the evening, return to the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and proceed to Mysore.
  • En-route, visit Srirangapatna, the summer palace of Tipu Sultan, an island fortress encircled by the River Cauvery, featuring high stone walls, moats, temples, palaces, and a great mosque.
  • Upon arrival in Mysore, check-in at the hotel.
  • Visit the Maharaja’s Palace, an Indo-Saracenic style palace, elaborately decorated with a jewel-studded golden throne.
  • Explore the Jaganmohan Palace, converted into an Art Gallery in 1875, showcasing paintings dating back to that era.
  • Visit the fabled Brindavan Gardens, famous for its dancing fountains and colorful lights, a major attraction for visitors.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Check-out of the hotel and drive to Ooty, a popular hill station in the Nilgiris, also known as the Blue Mountains due to the mist that envelops the range.
  • Ooty is situated at an elevation of 2286 meters and offers various breathtaking natural landscapes, each with its own unique grandeur.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • Enjoy the evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Proceed for a sightseeing tour of Ooty, exploring the picturesque hill slopes covered with tea estates, lush downs, and placid lakes, all set against a salubrious climate.
  • Visit the Botanical Gardens, laid out in 1847 by the Marquis of Tweeddale, showcasing a variety of exotic and ornamental plants. See a fossil tree trunk, believed to be 20 million years old.
  • Experience the charm of Ooty Lake, where you can indulge in paddle boating, though the lake is increasingly weed-locked.
  • Visit the Rose Garden, home to 1919 varieties of roses.
  • Explore the town’s historic British buildings, including the gothic St. Stephen’s Church (built in 1820), the Stone House bungalow, and Raj Bhawan (built in 1877).
  • Discover the Roman Catholic shrine, Kandal Cross, which is said to bear a relic of the True Cross, earning Ooty the title of the 'Jerusalem of the East.'
  • Evening: Free time to relax and enjoy at leisure.
  • Overnight: Stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and proceed for Cochin.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Morning: Explore Cochin, a port city rich in history and vibrant present-day life.
  • Visit the serene backwaters, golden sunsets, and lagoons surrounded by feathery coconut palms.
  • Discover picturesque islands such as Vypeen, Willingdon, Ramanthuruth, Vallarpadam, and Bolghatty, contributing to Cochin's stunning cityscape.
  • Tour the Jewish Synagogue, the oldest in India, and the Mattancherry Palace, once home to the former Maharajas.
  • See the iconic Chinese fishing nets, a technique that dates back to Kubla Khan’s court and still in use today.
  • Later in the day: Check out from the hotel and drive to Kumarakom.
  • Arrive and check-in at the hotel.
  • Overnight: Stay at the hotel in Kumarakom.

• Morning at leisure.
  • Later in the day, check-out from the hotel and proceed to Periyar, renowned for its wildlife and a must-see destination in Kerala.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • Afternoon: Enjoy a boat cruise on Periyar Lake, situated at the heart of the sanctuary, offering a unique opportunity to observe wildlife in their natural habitat.
  • Spot animals like wild elephants, majestic gaur, deer, wild boar, Nilgiri langur, and water birds along the lake.
  • The sanctuary is home to diverse wildlife including tigers, sambars, barking deer, mouse deer, Nilgiri tahr, wild dogs, porcupines, lion-tailed macaques, Malabar squirrels, and sloth bears.
  • Bird watchers can delight in spotting hornbills, blue-winged parakeets, whistling thrushes, flycatchers, and a variety of water birds.
  • Evening at leisure.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out from the hotel and proceed to Madurai.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • In the afternoon, proceed for a sightseeing tour of Madurai.
  • Visit the Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, located in the heart of the town. Admire the immense gopurams towering over the city and explore the intricately carved temple complex, a major pilgrimage and tourist destination.
  • Explore the Tirumalai Nayak Temple, known for its Indo-Saracenic architectural style, built in the 17th century. See the impressive pillars, ranging in height from 4m to 12m, and the 15 domes, three of which are enormous.
  • Visit the Palace Building within the Tirumalai Nayak Temple, featuring beautiful arches and unique ornamental workmanship.
  • Visit Vandiyur Mariamman Tank, a vast temple tank measuring 304.8 meters on each side, with a central mandapam.
  • Discover Madurai’s traditional handicrafts, particularly those made from brass and bronze, as the city is also a business hub for these crafts.
  • Evening at leisure to explore the local market.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check-out of the hotel and proceed for Tiruchirapalli.
  • Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
  • Afternoon: Proceed for a sightseeing tour of Tiruchirapalli, starting with the Rock Fort, perched on a massive rock that rises 83 meters above the plains.
  • Visit the Rock Fort Temple, built by the Nayak of Madurai, and learn about its historical significance during the Carnatic battles in the 18th century.
  • Explore Srirangam, a picturesque island between the Cauvery river and its tributary Kollidam, located north of Tiruchirapalli.
  • Visit the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, one of the largest Vaishnavite temples in South India, dating back to the 13th and 14th centuries.
  • Marvel at the 21 magnificent towers, stone pillars adorned with intricate carvings, and the seven walls surrounding the temple, within which the town is situated.
  • Evening: Leisure time to explore the local town.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check-out from the hotel and drive to Thanjavur.
  • Upon arrival: Check-in at the hotel.
  • Later: Proceed for a sightseeing tour of Thanjavur, known as the Rice Bowl of Tamil Nadu and home to many ancient temple wonders.
  • Visit the Brihadeeswara Temple (Big Temple of God), an architectural marvel built by the Cholas. The temple's tower rises 15 meters from a 28.8-meter square base, tapering to a total height of 64.8 meters, capped by an 81.3-tonne monolithic stone slab with winged niches on four sides.
  • Explore The Palace near the temple, a grand structure partly built by the Nayaks around 1550 AD and later expanded by the Marathas. The palace features vast corridors, spacious halls, and two towers: the armory and observation towers visible from all parts of the city.
  • Visit Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses over 30,000 palm leaf and paper manuscripts in Indian and European languages.
  • Evening: Leisure time to explore the local town.
  • Overnight: Stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and drive to Pondicherry.
  • Arrive in Pondicherry and check in at the hotel.
  • Later, proceed for a sightseeing tour of Pondicherry, visiting the former French colony's famous landmarks.
  • Visit the Aurobindo Ashram, which promotes a synthesis of Yoga and modern science to unite spirit and matter.
  • Explore Auroville, a unique township founded by Shree Aurobindo and The Mother in 1926, dedicated to yoga, meditation, and spiritual growth.
  • Evening at leisure to explore the local town.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning at leisure.
  • Later in the day, check out of the hotel and drive to Mamallapuram.
  • Upon arrival, check in at the hotel.
  • Proceed for a sightseeing tour, starting with The Shore Temple, one of the oldest temples, known for housing shrines dedicated to both Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu.
  • Visit The Five Rathas, five monolithic temples, each created in a different style, also known as the Pancha Pandava Rathas. Four out of the five rathas are carved from a single rock.
  • Explore Arjuna’s Penance, the world’s largest bas-relief measuring 27m x 9m, depicting gods, demigods, men, beasts, birds, and almost all of creation.
  • Evening at leisure to explore the local market.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and drive to Kanchipuram, one of India’s seven sacred cities, known as the Golden City.
  • Kanchipuram was historically the capital of the Pallavas, later the Cholas, and the Rayas of Vijayanagar.
  • Visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, an ancient temple featuring the 57-meter high Rajagopuram, one of the tallest towers in South India.
  • Explore other important temples such as the Kamakshi Amman Temple, a major site for Shakti worship in India.
  • Continue your journey to Chennai (72 km / 2 hrs).
  • Upon arrival in Chennai, check-in at the hotel.
  • Evening at leisure to explore the local town.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Proceed for a sightseeing tour of Chennai, exploring the city’s rich cultural heritage, ancient traditions, festivals, fine crafts, and classical music and dance.
  • Visit the Kapaleeswarar Temple, a stunning example of Dravidian architecture, with inscriptions dating back to 1250 AD.
  • Explore the Parthasarathy Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, originally built by the Pallavas in the 8th century.
  • Visit Fort St. George, built in 1640 AD, the first stronghold of British power in India.
  • Stop by St. Thomas Mount, the site where the Apostle St. Thomas was martyred in 72 AD.
  • In the afternoon, check out of the hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight to Mumbai.
  • Upon arrival in Mumbai, receive assistance and transfer directly to the International Airport for your onward journey.

Name: Grand South India Tour
LocationDescription: Mumbai – Bangalore – Hassan – Mysore – Ooty – Cochin – Kumarakom – Periyar – Madurai – Trichy – Thanjavur – Pondicherry – Mammalapuram – Kanchipuram – Chennai – Mumbai
Title: South India Tour Packages: Mumbai to Chennai Highlights
Description: Explore Mumbai, Bangalore, Mysore, Ooty, Cochin, Madurai, & Chennai with curated South India tour packages. Unforgettable cultural and scenic experiences await!
Additional_Information:
• Group tours available with a minimum of 2 participants
  • Suitable for families, couples, and solo travelers
  • Itinerary is subject to change based on weather conditions or unforeseen circumstances
  • This tour is available throughout the year, with customizable dates
Whats_Included:
• Accommodation in 3 to 5-star hotels with breakfast
  • Domestic flights from Trivandrum to Delhi
  • Transportation by air-conditioned vehicles throughout the tour
  • Expert English-speaking tour guides
  • Sightseeing and entrance fees to attractions
  • Assistance with transfers to and from airports
  • Airport transfers in both Mumbai and Chennai
  • Daily sightseeing tours to major attractions in each city
Overview: The South India Tour Package from Eaze Tours offers a captivating journey through the cultural and natural wonders of the region. Starting in Mumbai, you'll explore its iconic landmarks before traveling to Bangalore, Hassan, and Mysore, delving into historical sites and stunning landscapes. The tour continues through Ooty, Cochin, Kumarakom, Periyar, and Madurai, highlighting the beauty of Kerala's backwaters, wildlife sanctuaries, and temples. This comprehensive package promises a blend of heritage, nature, and adventure across South India's most cherished destinations. Each destination promises a unique and unforgettable experience.

description.S:
• Assistance upon arrival at Ahmedabad airport.
  • Transfer to the hotel.
  • Ahmedabad, founded in 1411, is known as the 'Manchester of the East.'
  • The city is located on the banks of the Sabarmati River.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Explore the architectural delights of Ahmedabad, including exquisitely carved wooden mansions, havelis, and labyrinthine lanes.
  • Visit the Calico Museum (with prior permission, closed on Wednesdays).
  • Discover the Jama Masjid and Sidi Mosque.
  • Visit the Gandhi Ashram, a key historical site.
  • Explore the impressive Adalaj Step Well.
  • Enjoy the vibrant Evening Market.
  • Overnight stay at a hotel in Ahmedabad.

name.S: Ahmedabad / Taranga / Vijaynagar ( 260 Kms – Including Visit)

description.S:
• After breakfast, drive to Vijaynagar, visiting en-route:
  • Taranga: Explore the Jain Temples of Taranga, one of the finest clusters of Jain temples in India, located 85 km from Balaram Palace Resort on a hilltop offering pristine views. The Ajitnath temple, built under the patronage of Solanki Rajput King Kumarapala, is famous for its beautiful carvings on pillars, domes, and brackets.
  • Idar: Visit historical sites and enjoy the natural beauty of Idar, which features the Idar Fort, an important historical landmark in Gujarat, as well as stunning rock formations and temples.
  • Afternoon arrival at Vijaynagar.
  • Later, visit nearby villages to explore the tribal belts on the borders of Gujarat and Rajasthan.

• After breakfast, embark on a full-day visit around Vijaynagar.
  • Located on the foothills of the Aravali Hills, Vijaynagar is surrounded by dense forests.
  • The area is home to many wild animals, including panthers, sloth bears, hyenas, and more.
  • Vijaynagar boasts over 200 varieties of birds, making it a haven for bird watchers.
  • This destination is perfect for nature and wildlife lovers.
  • Explore more than 20 ancient Jain and Shiv temples dating back to the 15th century.
  • The temples offer a treat for those fond of ancient art and architecture.
  • Vijaynagar is also a paradise for painters, with its scenic beauty and rich history.
  • Overnight stay at the palace.

• Morning: Leave for Zainabad/Dasada. En route, visit the Sun Temple at Modhera. Explore the city of Patan, known for Patola Silk weaving and the famous step well.
  • Evening: Arrive at the Little Rann of Kutch (Zainabad/Dasada). Visit nearby villages and the salt farm (if time permits).
  • Overnight: Stay in the Huts.

• Enjoy a game drive in the Little Rann of Kutch to see the Asiatic wild Ass (subject to the Monsoon; if there is heavy rain, the visit is not recommended).
  • In case of heavy rain, visit the villages around the Little Rann of Kutch instead.
  • Overnight stay at the Huts.

name.S: Day 7 Zainabad to Bhuj ( 280 Kms / 7 Hours)

description.S:
• Morning: Depart for Bhuj, an ancient walled city with maze-like streets and intricate crenellated gateways.
  • Afternoon: Visit the Ferguson Museum and Rao Pragmalji’s Palace, a stunning structure made of marble and sandstone.
  • Evening: Return to the hotel for an overnight stay.
    • Note:
  • A permit is required for access to the interior villages, and personal presence is necessary. Assistance with the procedure will be provided.
  • DSP/Collector Office hours: Monday to Saturday from 10:30 AM to 5:00 PM (closed on second Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays).

• Explore the tribal villages, each specializing in unique forms of handicraft.
  • Discover the intricate art of Ahir embroidery in these villages.
  • Learn about the traditional methods of block printing passed down through generations.
  • Experience the vibrant process of tie and dye, showcasing the region’s rich craftsmanship.

• Drive to Jamnagar.
  • In the afternoon, visit the princely states of Saurashtra, often referred to as Choti Kashi or Banaras due to its numerous Hindu and Jain temples.
  • Explore a Muslim dargah in the area.
  • Discover the region's famous tie-and-dye work on fabrics, along with exquisite silken and gold embroidery.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Depart for Dwarka.
  • Visit the Dwarkadheesh Temple (Jagat Mandir), located on the north bank of the Gomti Creek, dating back over 2,500 years.
  • Explore the architectural marvel of the temple, built with the same plan and system as other ancient Hindu temples.
  • Admire the Sixty columns supporting the roof of the audience hall in the Jagat Mandir.
  • Visit the main temple, which is five stories tall with a conical spire rising 157 feet.
  • View the one-meter tall, four-handed black Idol of Ranchhodrai, the ruler of Dwaraka.
  • Visit the Rukmini Temple, dedicated to Lord Krishna's wife, an incarnation of Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth and beauty.
  • Learn about Dwaraka’s history as the seat of Adi Shankaracharya, who established four spiritual seats (maths) across India.
  • Discover Sharad Peetha, the research center for Sanskrit established by Shankaracharya.
  • Afternoon: Suggest visiting Bet Dwarka, a nearby island.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• After breakfast, drive to Junagadh.
  • En route, visit Porbandar, the birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi, where he spent his childhood.
  • Explore Kirti Mandir, which showcases Gandhi’s philosophy in every facet and is situated next to his ancestral home.
  • Proceed to Junagadh, historically the capital of the Junagadh State under the Muslim Babi Nawabs. 'Junagadh' translates to 'ancient fort' in Gujarati.
  • The town is located at the foothills of the sacred Girnar Hill, a significant landmark in Gujarat's history.
  • Visit the two fortifications surrounding the town: the fort walls and Uparkot to the west.
  • Uparkot, an ancient citadel, was a stronghold of the Mauryan and Gupta Empires and withstood 16 sieges over the past 1000 years due to its strategic location.
  • Explore the entrance of Uparkot, which features a fine specimen of Hindu Toran, leading to a flat land dotted with archaeological sites.
  • Key sites to visit include Buddhist caves, Baba Pyara caves (2nd century), Adi-Kadi Vav, and Jami Masjid.
  • Evening visit (if time permits) and overnight at the hotel.

• After breakfast, visit the Junagadh Sightseeing.
  • If Girnar Temples are to be visited, be prepared for a 4-5 hour visit covering over 10,000 steps.
  • Optional lift chairs are available at an extra cost.
  • Later, proceed to Bhavnagar.
  • The Gohil Rajputs came to Gujarat from Marwar in 1260 A.D.
  • Founded by Bhavsinhji Gohil, the rulers of Sihor decided in 1723 A.D. to shift their capital from Sihor to Bhavnagar.
  • The shift aimed to take advantage of the sea for defensive purposes and maritime trade.
  • Bhavnagar is located on the scenic Gulf of Kambhat (Cambay) on the southeastern coast of Saurashtra.
  • It is an intermediate port with a natural harbor, surrounded by picturesque beauty, world-famous temples, and monumental edifices, reflecting the rich heritage of a bygone era.
  • Upon arrival, check in and enjoy an overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Bhavnagar ( Fullday excursion to Palitana – 60 Kms onway)

description.S:
• After breakfast, proceed for a full-day visit to Palitana.
  • Palitana, one of India’s most picturesque pilgrim centres, is located at the foot of Shatrunjaya Hill.
  • The site features 863 exquisitely carved temples, built in marble over a span of nine hundred years.
  • The architectural grandeur of Palitana transcends religious boundaries, attracting tourists of all faiths.
  • Palitana is also a significant symbol of Jainism, making it a must-visit for Jains and anyone interested in experiencing the blend of human ingenuity, architecture, philanthropy, and religious fervor.
  • The Shatrunjaya mountain is located about a kilometer from the town, with the path lined by sarais, minor temples, and Kala Bhandars (museums).
  • The mountain is closely associated with Rishabhdev, the first Tirthankar, also known as Adinath. It is believed that all Tirthankars, except Neminath, attained nirvana here.
  • The temples on the mountain are a combination of palaces and fortresses, made from splendid marble.
  • The visit to Palitana includes a climb of 3500 steps, taking about 4-5 hours (lift chairs are available at an extra cost).
  • Afterward, return to Bhavnagar for a city tour, which includes visits to:
    • Gaurishankar Lake, a beautiful picnic spot.
    • Takhteshwar Temple.
    • The Lock Gate.
  • Enjoy overnight stay in Bhavnagar.

• After breakfast, proceed to Ahmedabad.
  • On the way, visit Lothal, one of the southernmost outposts of the Indus Valley Civilization.
  • Explore Lothal, an example of Harappan town planning with its impressive dockyard, a marvel of maritime architecture.
  • The dockyard is connected to the Sabarmati River, which flows into the Arabian Sea at the Gulf of Cambay.
  • Discover the citadel, separated into an acropolis with paved baths and a lower town with residential quarters, coppersmith workshops, pottery sheds, and bead factories.
  • Marvel at the complex's advanced sanitary drainage system.
  • Visit the museum that showcases archaeological finds from the Indus Valley period.
  • Arrive in Ahmedabad in the evening.
  • Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure and indulge in last-minute shopping.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.
• In time transfer to Airport for onward destination.

description.S: • Met on arrival and transfer to hotel.

• Morning: Sightseeing tour of Old Delhi.
  • Visit Red Fort, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jehan.
  • Explore Jama Masjid, one of India's largest mosques.
  • Stop at Rajghat, Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial.
  • Afternoon: Sightseeing tour of New Delhi.
  • Visit Qutub Minar, India’s tallest stone tower.
  • Explore Chhatarpur Temple, known for its peaceful ambiance.
  • Discover Humayun’s Tomb, an inspiration for the Taj Mahal.
  • Visit the Bahai (Lotus) Temple, open to all faiths for meditation.
  • Evening: Leisure time.
  • Overnight: Stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check-out from the hotel and depart for Mandawa.
  • Arrival: Check-in at the hotel upon reaching Mandawa.
  • Sightseeing: Explore the Shekhawati region, known for its painted havelis and frescoes.
  • Experience: Discover the open-air gallery of Rajasthan.
  • Evening: Leisure time.
  • Overnight: Stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check out from the hotel and depart for Bikaner.
  • Upon Arrival in Bikaner, Check in at the hotel.
  • Bikaner is a royal fortified city with a timeless appeal, located in the north of the desert state and dotted with many sand dunes.
  • Sightseeing Junagarh Fort: Built in 1594 by Raja Rai Singh, a general in Emperor Akbar's army.
  • A formidable structure encircled by a moat, housing beautiful palaces within.
  • Constructed using red sandstone and marble, featuring picturesque courtyards, balconies, kiosks, and windows.
  • Lalgarh Palace: An architectural masterpiece in red sandstone.
  • Built by Maharaja Ganga Singh in memory of his father, Maharaja Lal Singh.
  • Notable for its intricate lattice and filigree work.
  • Surrounded by sprawling lawns adorned with blooming bougainvillea and frequented by dancing peacocks, offering a visual treat.
  • Evening: Leisure time to relax or explore the city at your own pace.
  • Overnight Stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and drive to Jaisalmer.
  • Arrive and check-in at the hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Explore Jaisalmer, often referred to as the 'Golden City,' rising from the Thar Desert like a golden mirage. Here's a structured itinerary to guide your visit:
  • Jaisalmer Fort: Perched 80 meters high on a hill, this fort serves as a sentinel to the vast desert landscape and houses an entire township within its ramparts.
  • Narrow Lanes and Havelis: Wander through enchanting, narrow lanes adorned with intricately designed havelis, each showcasing unique facades.
  • Jain Temples: Visit three beautifully sculpted Jain temples dating back to the 12th–15th centuries AD, dedicated to the Jain Tirthankaras – Rishabdev, Sambhavnath, and Parswanath.
  • Palaces: Explore five interconnected palaces within the fort, each reflecting the grandeur of Rajasthani architecture.
  • Fort Gateways: Enter the fort through its four main gateways – Akhaiya Pol, Ganesh Pol, Suraj Pol, and Hava Pol.
  • Gadisar Lake: Relax by this scenic rainwater lake, surrounded by numerous beautiful shrines and offering a spectacular variety of avian life.
  • Sam Sand Dunes: Experience the ripples on the wind-caressed dunes at Sam, creating an enchanting mirage. Enjoy camel safaris to immerse yourself in the desert's beauty.
  • Camel Safari: Embark on an exciting camel safari to truly experience the desert landscape. Various tour operators offer packages, including half-day and full-day safaris, often combined with cultural performances and traditional Rajasthani meals.
  • Evening at Leisure: Conclude your day with leisure activities, perhaps exploring local markets or enjoying traditional Rajasthani cuisine.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check out from the hotel and drive to Jodhpur.
  • Afternoon: Arrive in Jodhpur and check in at the hotel.
  • Sightseeing Tour:
  • Mehrangarh Fort: Explore this 5 km long, majestic fort situated on a 125-meter-high hill. Known for its formidable structure, the fort is approached by a winding road and features four gates. Within the fort, visit the Chamunda Mataji Temple and the museum housing various relics.
  • Jaswant Thada: Visit this cluster of royal cenotaphs built in 1899 AD in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II. The main cenotaph contains portraits of various Jodhpur rulers.
  • Evening: Leisure time to explore the local market.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning check-out of the hotel and drive to Jaipur.
  • Upon arrival check-in at the hotel.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Morning Excursion to Amber Fort:
  • Elephant Ride: Ascend to the fort atop an elephant, experiencing traditional royal transport.
  • Key Attractions:
  • Marble Palace: Explore the opulent palace adorned with intricate marble work.
  • Temple of Victory: Visit this historic temple, a testament to the fort's rich heritage.
  • Hall of Mirrors (Sheesh Mahal): Marvel at the dazzling mirror work that reflects light in mesmerizing patterns.
  • Afternoon City Tour to Jantar Mantar.
  • Outdoor Observatory: Visit the 18th-century astronomical observatory, built by Maharaja Jai Singh II, featuring instruments of remarkable precision.
  • City Palaces and Museums: Explore the resplendent palaces and museums within the City Palace, showcasing collections from the princely era.
  • Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds):
  • Architectural Marvel: Admire the five-story palace with its unique façade of windows and latticed screens, designed for the royal ladies to observe street life discreetly.
  • Evening at Leisure to explore local market.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Check out from the hotel.
  • En-route: Visit Fatehpur Sikri, the deserted capital of Emperor Akbar, abandoned due to water scarcity.
  • Afternoon: Continue the drive to Agra.
  • Evening: Arrive in Agra and check in at the hotel.
  • Rest of the day: Free for leisure activities.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Agra – Delhi Departure (Drive: 204 km / 4 ½ hrs)

description.S:
• Morning: Begin with a city tour of Agra.
  • Taj Mahal: Visit the Taj Mahal, a white marble mausoleum commissioned by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in 1631 as a tribute to his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Agra Fort: Explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, which offers a poignant view of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower across the Yamuna River.

description.S:
• Met on arrival and transfer to hotel.
  • Overnight at the hotel.

• Morning: Begin with a sightseeing tour of Old Delhi, a city rich in history and culture.
  • Red Fort: Visit the Red Fort, constructed by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan after relocating his capital from Agra.
  • Jama Masjid: Proceed to the Jama Masjid, one of the largest and most renowned mosques in India.
  • Raj Ghat: Conclude the morning with a visit to Raj Ghat, the memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi.
  • Afternoon: Continue with a tour of New Delhi's landmarks.
  • Qutub Minar: Explore the Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, built in 1191 AD.
  • Humayun’s Tomb: Visit Humayun’s Tomb, believed to have been designed by his widow, reflecting Mughal architecture.
  • Evening: Enjoy leisure time at your hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Arrival in Jaipur: Upon arrival, you'll be greeted and transferred to your hotel.
  • Leisure Time: Enjoy free time to relax until lunch.
  • City Tour: In the afternoon, embark on a guided tour of Jaipur's iconic landmarks:
  • Jantar Mantar: Visit the 18th-century astronomical observatory, renowned for its precision instruments.
  • City Palace: Explore the opulent palace complex, home to museums and courtyards reflecting royal heritage.
  • Hawa Mahal: Admire the 'Palace of Winds,' a five-story structure with intricate latticework, designed for royal women to observe street life.
  • Evening Leisure: Spend the evening exploring Jaipur's vibrant local markets.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning Excursion: Visit Amber Fort, situated atop a hill.
  • Elephant Ride: Experience a traditional elephant ride to the fort's entrance.
  • Fort Highlights: Explore the Marble Palace, Temple of Victory, and Hall of Mirrors within the fort.
  • Afternoon Leisure: Enjoy free time to relax.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Early morning depart for Jaipur, the Pink City, covering approximately 270 km over 6 hours.
  • En Route: Visit Fatehpur Sikri, the deserted capital of Emperor Akbar, renowned for its Mughal architecture.
  • Afternoon: Arrive in Jaipur and check into your hotel.
  • Arrive and check-in at the hotel.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Morning: Begin with a city sightseeing tour of Agra.
  • Taj Mahal: Visit the Taj Mahal, a white marble mausoleum commissioned by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in 1631 as a tribute to his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
  • Agra Fort: Explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, which offers a poignant view of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower across the Yamuna River.
  • Sikandra: Visit the Tomb of Akbar the Great in Sikandra, a magnificent gateway adorned with floral and geometric arabesque decorations in white and colored marble.
  • Evening: Leisure time to explore the local markets.
  • Overnight stay at the hotel.

name.S: Agra – Delhi (Drive: 203 Kms / 4 ½ hrs approximately)

description.S:
• Morning: Enjoy a leisurely morning at your hotel.
  • Afternoon: Depart for Delhi, approximately 203 km away, a journey of about 4.5 hours.
  • Evening: Upon arrival in Delhi, proceed directly to the airport to catch your flight to the next destination.
